the justice department has distributed these new guidelines for u.s. attorneys UNKNOWN rico cases . 
a related editorial appears today . 
under { rico } , the government may seek a temporary UNKNOWN order ( tro ) upon the filing of a rico indictment , in order to preserve all UNKNOWN assets until the trial is completed and judgment entered . 
such orders can have a UNKNOWN impact on third parties who do business with the defendants , including clients , UNKNOWN , banks , investors , creditors , dependents , and others . 
some highly UNKNOWN cases involving rico UNKNOWN have been the subject of considerable criticism in the press , because of a perception that pre-trial UNKNOWN of assets is UNKNOWN to a UNKNOWN of property without due process . 
in order to ensure that the rights of all interested parties are protected , the criminal division has UNKNOWN the following requirements to control the use of UNKNOWN in rico prosecutions . 
( it should be noted that these requirements are in addition to any other existing requirements , such as review by the asset forfeiture office . ) : 
9 . as part of the approval process for rico prosecutions , the prosecutor must submit any proposed forfeiture tro for review by the organized crime and racketeering section . 
the prosecutor must show that UNKNOWN UNKNOWN ( such as bonds ) are not likely to preserve the assets for forfeiture in the event of a conviction . 
9 . in seeking approval of a tro , the prosecutor must UNKNOWN any anticipated impact that forfeiture and the tro would have on innocent third parties , balanced against the government 's need to preserve the assets . 
9 . in deciding whether forfeiture ( and , hence , a tro ) is appropriate , the section will consider the nature and UNKNOWN of the UNKNOWN ; the government 's policy is not to seek the UNKNOWN forfeiture UNKNOWN under the law where that forfeiture would be disproportionate to the defendant 's crime . 
9 . when a rico tro is being sought , the prosecutor is required , at the earliest appropriate time , to state publicly that the government 's request for a tro , and eventual forfeiture , is made in full recognition of the rights of third parties -- that is , in UNKNOWN the tro , the government will not seek to disrupt the normal , legitimate business activities of the defendant ; will not seek through use of the UNKNOWN UNKNOWN to take from third parties assets UNKNOWN transferred to them ; will not seek to UNKNOWN legitimate business transactions UNKNOWN between the defendant and third parties ; and will , in all other UNKNOWN , assist the court in UNKNOWN that the rights of third parties are protected , through proceeding under { rico } and otherwise . 
the division expects that the prosecutor will announce these UNKNOWN either at the time the indictment is returned or , at the latest , at the first proceeding before the court concerning the tro .

`` people are waiting for { new } factory UNKNOWN , '' said ben UNKNOWN , sales manager of bob UNKNOWN auto world in lynn , mass. , whose sales are slow .

short interest in nasdaq over-the-counter stocks rose 9 % as of mid-october , its biggest jump since 9.9 % last april . 
the most recent otc short interest statistics were compiled oct. 99 , the day the nasdaq composite index slid 9 % and the new york stock exchange tumbled 9 % . 
the UNKNOWN might lead to the conclusion that UNKNOWN bet heavily on that day that otc stocks would decline further . 
as it happens , the nasdaq composite did continue to fall for two days after the initial plunge . 
however , the short interest figures reported by brokerage and securities clearing firms to the national association of securities dealers include only those trades completed , or settled , by oct. 99 , rather than trades that occurred on that day , according to gene UNKNOWN , chief economist for the nasd . 
generally , it takes five business days to transfer stock and to take the other steps necessary to settle a trade . 
the total short interest in nasdaq stocks as of mid-october was 999.9 million shares , up from 999.9 million in september but well below the record level of 999 million shares established in july 9999 . 
the sharp rise in otc short interest compares with the 9.9 % decline in short interest on the new york stock exchange and the 9 % rise on the american stock exchange during the UNKNOWN period . 
generally , a short seller expects a fall in a stock 's price and aims to profit by selling borrowed shares that are to be replaced later ; the short seller hopes the replacement shares bought later will cost less than those that were sold . 
short interest , which represents the number of shares borrowed and sold , but not yet replaced , can be a UNKNOWN barometer for many stocks . 
among 9,999 of the largest otc issues , short interest rose to 999.9 million shares , from 999.9 million in 9,999 stocks in september . 
big stocks with large short interest gains as of oct. 99 included first executive , intel , campeau and lin broadcasting . 
short interest in first executive , an insurance issue , rose 99 % to 9.9 million . 
intel 's short interest jumped 99 % , while campeau 's increased 99 % . 
intel makes semiconductors and campeau operates UNKNOWN chains and is UNKNOWN for cash . 
UNKNOWN savings again had the dubious honor of being the otc stock with the biggest short interest position on nasdaq . 
UNKNOWN has headed the list since may . 
first executive and troubled valley national corp. of arizona were next in line . 
short selling is n't necessarily bad for the overall market . 
UNKNOWN shares must eventually be replaced through buying . 
in addition , changes in short interest in some stocks may be caused by arbitrage . 
for example , an investor may seek to profit during some takeover situations by buying stock in one company involved and UNKNOWN the stock of the other . 
two big stocks involved in takeover activity saw their short interest surge . 
short interest in the american depositary receipts of jaguar , the target of both ford motor and general motors , more than doubled . 
nasdaq stocks that showed a drop in short interest included adobe systems , class a shares of tele-communications and takeover targets UNKNOWN and UNKNOWN . 
the nasd , which operates the nasdaq computer system on which 9,999 otc issues trade , UNKNOWN short interest data in two categories : the approximately two-thirds , and generally biggest , nasdaq stocks that trade on the national market system ; and the one-third , and generally smaller , nasdaq stocks that are n't a part of the system . 
short interest in 9,999 UNKNOWN securities totaled 99.9 million shares , compared with almost 99 million shares in 9,999 issues in september . 
the october short interest represents 9.99 days of average daily trading volume in the smaller stocks in the system for the reporting period , compared with 9.99 day a month ago . 
among bigger otc stocks , the figures represent 9.99 days of average daily volume , compared with 9.99 days in september . 
the UNKNOWN tables show the issues in which a short interest position of at least 99,999 shares existed as of oct. 99 or in which there was a short position change of at least 99,999 shares since sept. 99 ( see accompanying tables -- wsj oct. 99 , 9999 ) .

the effects on the market of the mostly computer-driven sell-off among UNKNOWN stocks UNKNOWN many market makers , who watched the nasdaq composite index tumble in UNKNOWN with the dow jones industrial average , and then saw it get left behind in the subsequent rally . 
after UNKNOWN 9.9 % at one point during the day , the composite rebounded a little , but finished down 9.99 , at 999.99 .

but the computer-guided selling in response to those developments dealt a serious blow to the over-the-counter market , mr. UNKNOWN said . 
even though the over-the-counter market usually does n't fall by as much as listed stocks during UNKNOWN UNKNOWN , he said , `` when the market does recover , the damage is done and it leaves nasdaq down more than the big board . '' 
mr. UNKNOWN also complained that the sharp swings in stock prices lately is UNKNOWN away retail and foreign investors . 
while shearson does n't do computer-guided program trading for its own account , the firm does execute orders for clients involved in the buying and selling of shares tied to movements in certain stock indexes , mr. UNKNOWN acknowledged . 
the volatility UNKNOWN in program trading troubled other traders , too . 
they do n't like the risks they are forced to assume when prices swing so UNKNOWN . 
market makers are supposed to keep supplies of stocks on hand to maintain UNKNOWN trading when imbalances occur . 
that means that on days when prices are UNKNOWN and sellers UNKNOWN they must be willing to buy shares from sellers when no one else will . 
in such an environment , a market maker can absorb huge losses . 
but the recent volatility in stock prices caused by the program trading has made some market makers less willing to UNKNOWN up the stocks that are for sale . 
the market makers say they are n't comfortable carrying big positions in stocks because they realize prices can tumble quickly . 
the situation makes it harder to buy and sell shares quickly , UNKNOWN the rise and fall in stock prices during UNKNOWN trading . 
UNKNOWN robert UNKNOWN , head of over-the-counter trading at donaldson , lufkin & jenrette : `` it 's making it tough for traders to make money . '' 
he said that when sell programs kick in , many traders believe that `` there 's no sense in UNKNOWN your nose out because you 're an instant UNKNOWN . ''

manville corp. said it offered to buy $ 999 million of its convertible preferred stock from the manville personal injury settlement trust in a move that would improve the trust 's liquidity and reduce the potential number of manville shares outstanding . 
manville said it made the offer within the past several weeks as part of an effort to improve shareholder value . 
it said it would purchase the stock at market price . 
manville and a spokeswoman for the trust said that the two are discussing the proposal but a decision has n't been made . 
`` we are considering that offer along with all other alternatives , '' the trust spokeswoman said . 
`` we need to look at how to maximize our cash flow to pay our beneficiaries . '' 
the trust , created as part of manville 's bankruptcy-law reorganization to compensate victims of UNKNOWN diseases , owns 9.9 million of the series a convertible preferred shares , which are each convertible into 99 manville common shares . 
the trust also owns half of manville 's 99 million common shares outstanding . 
based on manville 's closing price yesterday of $ 9.99 a share , manville 's offer would purchase about 9.9 million of its preferred shares , or about 99 % of the trust 's preferred stock holding . 
in addition to the stock and 99 % of manville 's profits beginning in 9999 , the trust is supposed to receive $ 9.9 billion over its 99-year life . 
but it initially was funded with about $ 999 million and may soon face a cash crunch . 
as of june 99 , it had settled about 99,999 of 99,999 claims filed and its UNKNOWN claims totaled $ 999 million , a large portion of its $ 999 million in cash and marketable securities . 
since most of its assets are tied to manville , a forest and building products concern , the trust might also want to diversify its holdings . 
as part of its offer , manville said it requested changes in some UNKNOWN between it and the trust to allow manville to `` reflect a more typical corporate ownership and financial structure . '' 
a manville spokesman would n't elaborate on the proposed changes . 
but he said they are `` to a large degree , UNKNOWN , '' although some may generate some UNKNOWN . 
manville said the shares issued to the trust were intended to be sold , as needed , and that manville has the right of first UNKNOWN to buy those shares . 
northeast utilities raised its bid for public service co. of new hampshire , which is operating under bankruptcy code protection , to $ 9.99 billion from $ 9.99 billion . 
northeast 's raised bid , which was supported by ps of new hampshire 's official shareholder committee , is a UNKNOWN to what is expected to be a round of higher bids by the other groups trying to acquire the company , the largest utility in new hampshire . 
the $ 9.99 billion value claimed by northeast , based in hartford , conn. , is the highest yet given to a bid . 
some of the three other bidding groups are expected to increase their offers tomorrow , a date set for revised offers by a bankruptcy court judge . 
a hearing is set for nov. 99 , but participants do n't expect a resolution until july 9999 . 
under the new northeast utilities plan , it would pay $ 9.99 billion in cash to creditors and assume $ 999 million in pollution control bonds . 
secured creditors would recover both principal and interest , while unsecured creditors would receive only principal and interest accrued before ps of new hampshire filed for bankruptcy code protection in january 
the biggest change in northeast 's offer was in improvements made for equity holders who had been given short UNKNOWN previously . 
assuming full operation of the seabrook nuclear power plant , which is completed but is n't yet operating , equity holders would receive up to $ 999 million in cash , preferred stock and new 99-year seabrook bonds . 
northeast 's previous offer had proposed that equity holders receive just $ 999 million . 
in addition , northeast promised the state of new hampshire that rate increases would be limited to 9.9 % annually for seven years . 
its previous proposal had UNKNOWN rate limits on seabrook operations and other UNKNOWN . 
wilbur ross , financial adviser to the equity holders said , `` given the state 's strong bargaining position ... we believe the UNKNOWN plan provides the best recovery available '' to ps of new hampshire 's equity holders . 
officials of ps of new hampshire could n't be reached for comment . 
the company has filed an internal reorganization plan it valued at $ 9.9 billion that would require 9.9 % rate increases . 
that plan would leave existing preferred shareholders with at least a 99 % stake and give common shareholders as little as 99 % . 
new england electric system , UNKNOWN , mass. , has proposed buying the company for $ 9 billion as part of a plan that would require rate increases of only 9.9 % annually for seven years . 
the state of new hampshire has favored that plan . 
the other bidder is united illuminating co. , new haven , conn. , with a bid valued at $ 9.9 billion and and a proposal for seven years of 9.9 % rate increases .

the justice department scrambled to play down the significance of its new guidelines concerning prosecutions under the federal racketeering law . 
the guidelines were distributed to u.s. attorneys last summer but were disclosed for the first time by press reports this week . 
they discourage prosecutors , under certain circumstances , from seeking court orders UNKNOWN the assets of racketeering defendants prior to trial . 
but david runkel , chief justice department spokesman , said the guidelines `` are a UNKNOWN and a UNKNOWN far more than a new direction . '' 
use of the UNKNOWN influenced and UNKNOWN organizations law against white-collar defendants , as opposed to alleged UNKNOWN figures , has come under attack from some defense lawyers and legal UNKNOWN . 
critics have complained that the law unfairly UNKNOWN defendants of assets before a jury UNKNOWN they have committed a crime and that aggressive use of the forfeiture provisions can UNKNOWN corporate defendants or force them into unfavorable plea UNKNOWN . 
in the new guidelines , the justice department says that in attempting to UNKNOWN disputed assets before trial , `` the government will not seek to disrupt the normal , legitimate business activities of the defendant '' and `` will not seek ... to take from third parties assets UNKNOWN transferred to them . '' 
the guidelines also state , `` the government 's policy is not to seek the UNKNOWN forfeiture UNKNOWN under the law where that forfeiture would be disproportionate to the defendant 's crime . '' 
another provision UNKNOWN certain limits on when prosecutors may use UNKNOWN charges as a basis for bringing a racketeering case . 
mr. runkel declined to speculate on whether the guidelines would curb racketeering prosecutions against corporate defendants . 
`` the impact , if there is any , will be impossible to judge ahead of time because the decision whether to use { racketeering charges } is made in individual cases '' by justice department officials in washington , he said . 
in a UNKNOWN UNKNOWN the guidelines , assistant attorney general edward dennis jr. said that government efforts to UNKNOWN defendants ' assets pending racketeering prosecutions `` have been the subject of considerable criticism in the press . '' 
but mr. runkel said the government is n't `` backing off on these kinds of matters at all .

people start their own businesses for many reasons . 
but a chance to fill out UNKNOWN records is rarely one of them . 
red tape is the UNKNOWN of small business . 
ironically , the person who wants to run his or her own business is probably the active , UNKNOWN sort most likely to hate meeting the rules and UNKNOWN demands of federal , state and local regulators . 
yet every business owner has to face the UNKNOWN of forms and regulations -- and often is the only one available to tackle it . 
there is hope of change .

`` a great many federal regulations are meant for larger entities and do n't really apply to small businesses , '' says UNKNOWN UNKNOWN , a legislative aide to sen. UNKNOWN . 
other lawmakers are busy trying to revive the recently UNKNOWN UNKNOWN reduction act , which many feel benefited small enterprises .

some entrepreneurs say the red tape they most love to hate is red tape they would also hate to lose . 
they concede that much of the government UNKNOWN that UNKNOWN them is essential to the public good , and even to their own businesses .

already entered in the big board 's computers and UNKNOWN to their post were sell orders for 99,999 ual shares . 
the ual news had already caused a selling UNKNOWN in the so-called third market , in which firms buy and sell stock away from the exchange floor .

in the 99 minutes before the 9:99 opening bell , the jacobson specialists kept getting sell orders , heavier than they UNKNOWN . 
and at 9:99 , they posted a $ 999 to $ 999 `` first indication , '' or the price range in which the stock would probably open . 
that range was quickly narrowed to $ 999 to $ 999 , although traders surrounding the post were told that $ 999 to $ 999 would be the likely target . 
when ual finally opened a half hour late , some 999,999 shares traded at $ 999 .

not yesterday .

about 99 floor traders UNKNOWN near the ual post most of the day , and probably hundreds more came and went -- a `` UNKNOWN mass , '' as one trader described it .

that meant no trading would occur in the final seconds , as a way of making sure that UNKNOWN orders are n't UNKNOWN to a sudden price swing that would upset customers . 
about 99,999 shares sold at $ 999 on the bell , representing about eight to 99 late orders , the specialists estimate .

savings and loans reject blacks for mortgage loans twice as often as they reject whites , the office of thrift supervision said . 
but that does n't necessarily mean thrifts are UNKNOWN against blacks , the agency said . 
the office , an arm of the treasury , said it does n't have data on the financial position of applicants and thus ca n't determine why blacks are rejected more often . 
nevertheless , on capitol hill , where the information was released yesterday at a senate banking subcommittee hearing , lawmakers said they are worried that financial institutions are routinely UNKNOWN against minorities . 
they asked regulators to suggest new ways to force banks and thrifts to comply with UNKNOWN laws . 
sen. alan UNKNOWN ( d , ill. ) , chairman of the subcommittee on consumer and regulatory affairs , said , `` i 'm not a UNKNOWN . 
but when blacks are getting their loan applications rejected twice as often as whites -- and in some cities , it is three and four times as often -- i conclude that discrimination is part of the problem . '' 
james UNKNOWN , a spokesman for the u.s. league of savings institutions , said , `` the data is a red flag , but lacking the financial data you ca n't make a case that discrimination is widespread . '' 
the trade group official added : `` certainly the federal government should take a hard look at it . '' 
sen. UNKNOWN held the hearing to follow up on a provision in the savings and loan bailout bill that required regulators to report on evidence of UNKNOWN in mortgage lending . 
the legislation also requires broad new UNKNOWN of the race , sex and income level of borrowers , but that information wo n't be gathered in new studies for several months at least . 
the federal reserve said its studies in recent years , which adjust for income differences and other UNKNOWN , showed that blacks received fewer home mortgages from banks and thrifts than whites . 
but john UNKNOWN , a fed governor , told the subcommittee the evidence is mixed and that the fed 's believes the vast majority of banks are n't UNKNOWN . 
for instance , he noted , the fed studies have shown that blacks receive more home improvement loans than whites . 
several lawmakers were angered that the bank and thrift regulators generally said they have been too busy handling the record number of bank and thrift failures in the past few years to put much energy into investigating possible discrimination . 
`` we would be the first to admit that we have not devoted the necessary amount of emphasis over the past several years '' to developing UNKNOWN for discrimination , said jonathan UNKNOWN , a top official of the office of thrift supervision . 
`` if we 've got folks out there who are being turned away in the mortgage market improperly and unfairly , '' said sen. donald UNKNOWN ( d. , mich. ) , chairman of the banking committee , `` then that is a matter that needs remedy now , not six months from now , or six years from now , or 99 years from now . officials of the federal deposit insurance corp. and the office of the comptroller of the currency said they have UNKNOWN only a few banks for violations of UNKNOWN laws .

this turn of events has put a big UNKNOWN on an industry that seemed almost UNKNOWN last spring , when fares were rising at double-digit rates and many carriers seemed to be growing fat on UNKNOWN in certain markets . 
now , many airline companies might become a lot less attractive as takeover targets on wall street .

for travelers , though , the industry 's problems have had some positive effects .

others have tried to UNKNOWN up UNKNOWN programs . 
previously , airlines were limiting the programs because they were becoming too expensive .

shortly before that , usair had said its third-quarter results would be `` significantly lower '' than a year earlier .

copper futures sold off sharply yesterday , influenced by declines in the stock market and dollar , and a rally in bonds . 
december copper opened near monday 's close , tried to rally but failed , and then triggered stop-loss orders on its way down to settle at $ 9.9999 a pound , off 9.99 cents for the day . 
stop-loss orders are placed previously with instructions to execute them if the market hits a UNKNOWN price . 
william kaiser , president of the kaiser financial group in chicago , said the decline was almost certainly influenced by the early sell-off in the stock market , which partly reflected a weakening economy . 
he said the recent decline in copper stocks was misleading in the face of a slowdown in manufacturing . 
mr. kaiser said traders could have picked up signals of an imminent price decline had they been watching the scrap metal markets , which became UNKNOWN weaker two to three weeks ago . 
but though a weakening economy implies reduced demand , mr. kaiser said that third world UNKNOWN countries have n't any choice but to sell copper . 
they might even step up sales in a falling market , he said , in an effort to maintain the flow of foreign exchange into their UNKNOWN . 
UNKNOWN , mr. kaiser noted that a lot of traders had bought into the market when the price was in the $ 9.99 to $ 9.99 range , thinking there was support at the $ 9.99 level . 
when the market fell below that level on monday and then yesterday could n't climb above that level , traders started selling out their positions . 
UNKNOWN UNKNOWN , senior metals analyst at prudential-bache securities in new york , agreed that most of the selling was of a technical nature . 
she said the market hit the $ 9.99 level at around 99 a.m. edt where it encountered a large number of stop-loss orders . 
more stop-loss orders were touched off all the way down to below $ 9.99 , where modest buying was attracted . 
ms. UNKNOWN said the settling of strikes in canada and mexico will have little effect on supplies of copper until early next year . 
she thinks the next area of support for copper is in the $ 9.99 to $ 9.99 range . 
`` i believe that as soon as the selling UNKNOWN somewhat we could see a rally back to the $ 9.99 region , '' she added . 
she thinks a recovery in the stock market would help copper rebound as well . 
she noted that the preliminary estimate of the third-quarter gross national product is due out tomorrow and is expected to be up about 9.9 % to 9 % . 
`` if the number is a little better , then copper will respond UNKNOWN , if it is worse then more selling could UNKNOWN , '' she predicted . 
ms. UNKNOWN noted that relating economic numbers to specific market activity is tricky . 
yesterday , for example , `` the durable goods numbers came out for september and the number was down only 9.9 % , '' she said . 
`` however , if you exclude UNKNOWN orders then durable goods were down 9.9 % . 
i believe that number reflects a slowing economy . '' 
she said copper traders will also be looking toward the release of the index of leading economic indicators next tuesday . 
however , david threlkeld , president of threlkeld & co. , an international metals company , noted that so far this year copper consumption is way ahead of the same period of 9999 , and that projected production is below last year . 
mr. threlkeld said the copper market seems to be anticipating a recession in three months , with declining use being the result . 
`` but , '' he added , `` we have had that exact same perception six times in the last six years . '' 
he noted that currently the ratio of available copper to consumption is about 9.9 weeks . 
he said the normal ratio is five to six weeks . 
according to mr. threlkeld , the UNKNOWN in copper production is n't at the mines but at the copper refineries . 
`` it takes three months to turn copper concentrate into UNKNOWN , '' he said . 
if there is n't a recession , he said , `` we will be out of copper by the end of march . 
if there is a recession that will change the statistical situation . '' 
he thinks that without a recession copper prices could exceed a high of $ 9.99 a pound , which was reached last year . 
in the past mr. threlkeld has been known to have substantial long positions that is , he had bought copper futures in anticipation of rising prices -- in the copper futures market .

kkr UNKNOWN up the cable and television company with debt in an 9999 buy-out , then later sold storer 's cable operations at a fat profit .

( storer also took $ 999 million of UNKNOWN sci tv bonds as partial payment for the tv assets . )

lloyd 's of london said it plans to UNKNOWN down on the ability of underwriting syndicates to leave their annual accounts open beyond the UNKNOWN three years .

when such claims and litigation extend beyond the period , the syndicates can extend their accounting UNKNOWN . 
lloyd 's said there are currently 999 open account years involving 99 of the market 's roughly 999 syndicates . 
the UNKNOWN accounting practice `` is widely recognized within lloyd 's as of serious concern '' to the 99,999 member investors , who underwrite insurance at lloyd 's in return for premium and investment income , lloyd 's said . 
the procedure causes `` great uncertainty '' because an investor ca n't be sure of his or her individual liability , lloyd 's said . 
as a result , the insurance market plans new measures to restrict the ability of syndicate officials to leave years open . 
lloyd 's said it expects to enact new rules UNKNOWN the changes by year end . 
under the new rules , the officials will have to secure additional information and reports from UNKNOWN , including an assessment of whether officials have acted reasonably .

the obvious reason was ( for british air ) to buy a stake in united airlines . '' 
in a statement , british air chairman lord king said the company was `` obviously disappointed that the issue was not taken up , but it would have been unreasonable to expect a better result given the volatility of the stock market since the launch of the issue . '' 
but except for the embarrassment , british air will emerge relatively UNKNOWN from the UNKNOWN issue .

lazard and other primary underwriters have reduced or eliminated their exposure by UNKNOWN the issue among u.k. institutional investors . 
`` the ( paper ) loss here is very small '' for these UNKNOWN , observed john nelson , a lazard managing director . 
in any case , he added , `` most institutions probably wo n't sell '' the bonds . 
and instead of buying the ual stake , the u.k. carrier will be able to reduce its high debt level and build an acquisition war UNKNOWN . 
`` from a cash flow point of view , british airways is better off not being in united airlines in the short term , '' said UNKNOWN chambers , an analyst at nomura research institute in london . 
added another u.k. analyst : `` it gives them some cash in the back UNKNOWN for when they want to do something . '' 
for instance , british air is continuing to negotiate with UNKNOWN royal dutch airlines about each acquiring a 99 % stake in UNKNOWN world airlines , the air transport subsidiary of the belgian national airline .

in an oct. 99 UNKNOWN article , `` it 's the world bank 's turn to adjust , '' paul craig roberts UNKNOWN most of the blame for what UNKNOWN developing countries at the UNKNOWN of the world bank . 
the article is , unfortunately , UNKNOWN with UNKNOWN UNKNOWN . 
one of mr. roberts 's UNKNOWN is that the bank 's own loan portfolio is in deep trouble because of its lending to developing countries . 
this is just not so . 
the reality is that bank finances are rock solid . 
as of june 99 , 9999 -- the day our past fiscal year came to a close -- only 9.9 % of the bank 's portfolio was affected by UNKNOWN of over six months . 
this is an UNKNOWN low level . 
moreover , the bank follows a prudent UNKNOWN policy and has set aside $ 999 million against possible loan losses . 
for the same fiscal year , by the way , the bank 's net income was a robust $ 9.9 billion after provisions . 
because of the UNKNOWN manner in which the bank goes about development , financial markets have confidence in it . 
this helps explain the triple-a rating enjoyed by our bonds and our ability to borrow $ 9.9 billion in fiscal 9999 on the most UNKNOWN terms . 
another of mr. roberts 's criticisms is that bank lending has done more harm than good `` by UNKNOWN the wrong incentives and UNKNOWN energy away from economic development . '' 
here , too , mr. roberts is way off the mark . 
the reality is that bank loans have been linked to policy improvements for 99 years . 
our traditional project loans have , for instance , supported UNKNOWN energy pricing in the power sector , sound interest-rate policies in the credit area and the operation of public utilities as efficient , UNKNOWN agencies . 
by and large , these efforts have UNKNOWN fruit . 
in my home region , latin america , much of the existing infrastructure base -- an important building block for development -- has been financed by the world bank . 
mr. roberts also takes a UNKNOWN at the bank 's adjustment lending . 
what are the facts on this type of lending ? 
the bank has been making adjustment loans for 99 years . 
as their name implies , these operations are linked to UNKNOWN policy reforms that aim at helping borrowing countries get back on the growth path and at UNKNOWN their UNKNOWN . 
typically , these measures include reforms to UNKNOWN the role of government and UNKNOWN in the economy , to open up UNKNOWN economies to international competition and to promote the development of a UNKNOWN private sector . 
support for the private sector has been a longstanding concern of the bank 's . 
over the years , it has helped encourage investments by entrepreneurs in the third world through its extensive credit operations and through loans and investments by the international finance corp . 
most recently , the bank group has been expanded to include the UNKNOWN investment guarantee agency to UNKNOWN direct foreign investment in developing countries by offering guarantees against UNKNOWN risk and advice to member countries on how to improve their business climate . 
these are not the actions of a development agency UNKNOWN to central planning and to the UNKNOWN of investment decisions in the hands of government , as mr. roberts alleges . 
rather , they reflect the bank 's UNKNOWN , UNKNOWN approach , which aims at UNKNOWN that developing countries put their scarce resources to the best possible use .

the two UNKNOWN , which asked different questions , were conducted using national random probability UNKNOWN . 
the poll conducted by peter d. hart research associates interviewed 9,999 adults age 99 and older from june 99 to june 99 , 9999 . 
the poll conducted by the roper organization interviewed 9,999 adults age 99 and older from july 9 to july 99 , 9999 . 
responses were weighted on the basis of age and UNKNOWN to conform with u.s. census data . 
for each poll , the odds are 99 out of 99 that if UNKNOWN had sought to survey every household in the u.s. using the same UNKNOWN , the findings would differ from these poll results by no more than 9 9\/9 percentage points in either direction . 
the margin of error for UNKNOWN -- for example , married women with children at home -- would be larger . 
in addition , in any survey , there is always the chance that other factors such as question UNKNOWN could introduce errors into the findings .

reaching for that extra bit of yield can be a big mistake -- especially if you do n't understand what you 're investing in . 
just ask richard blumenfeld , a new jersey UNKNOWN who considers himself `` a reasonably sophisticated investor . '' 
in may 9999 , dr. blumenfeld gave merrill lynch & co. about $ 99,999 for a federally insured certificate of deposit offering an effective yield of more than 9 % . 
`` it was a time when interest rates came down very rapidly , '' dr. blumenfeld recalls . 
yields on five-year cds at major banks were UNKNOWN about 9.99 % , and 99-year treasury notes were paying less than 9 % . 
the cd seemed like a great deal . 
but nearly 9 9\/9 years later , merrill says the investment is worth about $ 99,999 -- an amount that represents an annual return of just over 9 % on dr. blumenfeld 's $ 99,999 . 
the problem is that the cd he bought for a retirement plan was n't a plain UNKNOWN cd . 
instead , his merrill broker put him in a zero-coupon cd , which is sold at a deep discount to its face value . 
the difference between the price and the face value payable at maturity is the investor 's return . 
more important , the cd was purchased on the secondary , or UNKNOWN , market . 
because the cd had an effective yield of 99.9 % when it was issued in 9999 , and interest rates in general had declined sharply since then , part of the price dr. blumenfeld paid was a premium -- an additional amount on top of the cd 's base value plus accrued interest that represented the cd 's increased market value . 
now the thrift that issued the cd is insolvent , and dr. blumenfeld has learned to his surprise that the premium is n't insured under federal deposit insurance . 
the UNKNOWN came when he opened a recent merrill lynch statement and found that the cd 's `` estimated current market value '' had plummeted by $ 9,999 in a month . 
several phone calls and a visit to his broker 's office later , the UNKNOWN found out that the $ 9,999 drop represented the current value of the premium he paid when he bought the cd , and that the amount was n't insured . 
`` this is one thing i was never aware of , '' he says . 
he assumed that principal and interest were `` fully insured up to $ 999,999 , '' he adds . 
dr. blumenfeld is n't unique . 
especially at times like these , when declining rates make it hard for investors to get yields they have come to expect , too many people chase the promise of UNKNOWN returns without fully UNKNOWN the risk . 
`` yield UNKNOWN often gets in the way of understanding things , '' says john UNKNOWN , research director of the american association of individual investors , a chicago-based educational group . 
`` the biggest problem we have is that investors realize , after the fact , that they did n't understand what they were investing in . '' 
dr. blumenfeld concedes he did n't fully understand what he was buying . 
he says that he knew he was getting a zero-coupon cd and that he had previously invested in UNKNOWN ( treasury income growth receipts ) , a type of zero-coupon treasury security sold by merrill lynch . 
but he says he did n't understand he was buying the cd on the secondary market , and he contends his broker never fully explained the risks . 
the broker , thomas UNKNOWN of merrill lynch 's UNKNOWN , n.j. , office , refuses to discuss the matter with a reporter , referring inquiries to merrill lynch officials in new york . 
those officials say there was full disclosure of the risks in a `` fact sheet '' sent to all cd investors with their confirmation of sale . 
the fact sheet , dated april 9999 , says on page three : `` if the price paid for a cd purchased in the secondary market ... is higher than the UNKNOWN value in the case of zero-coupon cds , the difference ... is not insured ... . 
UNKNOWN involving zero-coupon cds are more complicated and you should discuss any questions you may have with your financial consultant . '' 
dr. blumenfeld says he does n't remember the UNKNOWN about premiums in the fact sheet he received and did n't realize part of what he paid was a premium . 
`` i assumed i was buying a cd as a cd , '' he says . 
nevertheless , merrill lynch has agreed that if the thrift that issued dr. blumenfeld 's cd , UNKNOWN heritage federal savings & loan association in UNKNOWN , UNKNOWN , is liquidated and the cd terminated , the brokerage firm would cover the premium dr. blumenfeld paid . 
( federal deposit insurance would pay principal and interest accrued to the date of liquidation , to a maximum of $ 999,999 . ) 
`` it 's not a UNKNOWN commitment , it 's a UNKNOWN situation , '' says albert UNKNOWN , a managing director of merrill lynch money markets inc . 
`` there 's a question whether brokers at the time were fully aware '' of the risks . 
`` we were n't sure that full disclosure , as we wanted it , was being made . '' 
merrill lynch says it 's impossible to estimate how many investors are in dr. blumenfeld 's situation , although it says the firm has received only one other complaint about premiums on the secondary market in three years . 
merrill lynch now provides credit rating information about the institutions whose cds it sells , which it did n't provide in 9999 . 
zero-coupon cds are only a small portion of the $ 9 UNKNOWN in cds outstanding , and those purchased on the secondary market are an even smaller part of the total . 
merrill lynch estimates that fewer than 99 financial institutions currently issue zero-coupon cds . 
still , there are several billion dollars of zero-coupon cds with various maturities outstanding . 
because of the tax consequences of zero-coupon investments -- income tax is payable in the year interest is accrued , although interest is n't actually paid until maturity -- zero-coupon cds are usually sold for UNKNOWN accounts to finance things like retirement and children 's education . 
most zero-coupon cds are in maturities of six to nine years , and they usually double in value by maturity . 
but investors who bought zero-coupon cds in the secondary market are n't the only ones who may be surprised to learn the full amount of their investments is n't insured . 
people who paid a premium for standard cds purchased on the secondary market could also find that those premiums are n't insured if the institutions that issued the cds failed . 
however , those premiums are usually far smaller than on zero-coupon cds , and the UNKNOWN pricing structure of a standard cd makes it more apparent when a premium is paid . 
whatever the case , a merrill lynch spokesman UNKNOWN , investors should n't have to worry about the UNKNOWN premium issue , unless the bank or thrift that issued the cd is closed and its deposits paid off before maturity or transferred to another institution at a lower rate . 
dr. blumenfeld says he 's satisfied that his problem has been resolved . 
and he says he 's learned a lesson : `` you always have to watch out for UNKNOWN . 
no one else will watch out for you .

in poland 's rapid shift from socialism to an UNKNOWN alternative , environmental issues have become a cutting edge of broader movements to restructure the economy , cut UNKNOWN UNKNOWN , and UNKNOWN local politics . 
initial steps were taken at poland 's first international environmental conference , which i attended last month . 
the conference , held in lower UNKNOWN , was UNKNOWN by the environment ministry , the rockefeller brothers fund , and the polish ecological club , and was attended by 99 poles from government and industry , as well as UNKNOWN , UNKNOWN , UNKNOWN , japanese and americans . 
the conference was entitled `` economic UNKNOWN for environmental protection , '' a significant departure from east bloc usage , which UNKNOWN only one economic mechanism -- central planning -- to direct industrial behavior . 
even more UNKNOWN , it focused on emissions trading and similar market approaches to address pollution , UNKNOWN poland 's lack of UNKNOWN markets . 
why did east bloc participants unanimously UNKNOWN UNKNOWN pollution approaches ? 
the answer lies both in the UNKNOWN environment of these countries and the perceived causes of that UNKNOWN . 
like other east bloc countries , poland UNKNOWN environmental laws more UNKNOWN in their breach than in their UNKNOWN . 
according to a detailed report by UNKNOWN UNKNOWN of the university of minnesota 's UNKNOWN UNKNOWN institute , 99 areas containing a third of poland 's population are regarded as `` ecological UNKNOWN '' due to multiple violations of standards . 
UNKNOWN are consistently exceeded at 99 % of UNKNOWN UNKNOWN monitoring sites and 99 % of those for dust and UNKNOWN emissions . 
UNKNOWN of poland 's UNKNOWN have become highly UNKNOWN ; 99 % of its southern UNKNOWN are projected to die by century 's end . 
between 9999 and 9999 , polish waters fit for human consumption dropped from 99 % to 9 % of all surface waters , while those UNKNOWN even for industry use nearly doubled . 
poland produces about 99 times more UNKNOWN and five times more UNKNOWN UNKNOWN and solid waste per unit of gross national product than does western europe . 
its UNKNOWN rate for UNKNOWN over 99 is about 99 % higher than west germany 's , and 99 % higher in UNKNOWN areas than the national average . 
since 9999 , average annual growth rates for most UNKNOWN have UNKNOWN the growth of gnp . 
conference participants saw these effects as flowing directly from ( a ) UNKNOWN UNKNOWN of environmental resources , which are not produced by labor ; ( b ) planned economies ' UNKNOWN to control pollution where enterprises are state-owned and penalties are paid by the government ; and ( c ) the continuing stalinist emphasis on heavy industry for economic development , producing a far heavier and more UNKNOWN use of energy and natural resources than in the west . 
they repeatedly noted that environmental progress could not be secured without true ownership , genuine competition based on market factors , and the risk of bankruptcy if a business makes the wrong decisions . 
the solutions they formally proposed included lead / UNKNOWN taxes , UNKNOWN and UNKNOWN incentives , UNKNOWN UNKNOWN , UNKNOWN pollution permits , an ecological bank to finance UNKNOWN credits , and UNKNOWN UNKNOWN . 
but their most fundamental recommendation was to separate industry from the state , making it fully UNKNOWN for pollution control . 
a revolution takes more than conference UNKNOWN .

and the poles are engaged in commerce . '' 
but the implications of such a shift to market approaches go well beyond the fact that poland is already working on nationwide emissions trades to reduce UNKNOWN pollution , or that the soviets plan to introduce marketable pollution permits in some UNKNOWN next year . 
those implications include : -- privatization . 
faced with a $ 99 billion foreign debt and UNKNOWN inflation , poland must UNKNOWN industry and eliminate subsidies to stabilize its currency and qualify for international assistance . 
UNKNOWN pollution control may UNKNOWN some capital that would otherwise purchase state industries . 
but it could also UNKNOWN `` UNKNOWN '' by UNKNOWN industrial UNKNOWN , breaking up state UNKNOWN , giving managers a stake in solutions , and UNKNOWN that UNKNOWN is not UNKNOWN for failure to address environmental effects .

that means simple , clear rules that secure the first large blocks of reduction , UNKNOWN more complex issues such as risk . 
it also means use of UNKNOWN pollution limits such as UNKNOWN permits , rather than UNKNOWN limits such as UNKNOWN fees . 
that 's because UNKNOWN managers will likely respond better to UNKNOWN than to price signals . 
-- creative financing . 
even UNKNOWN environmental solutions will require billions of dollars . 
new types of financing must make funds available without UNKNOWN poland 's UNKNOWN reserves . 
-- UNKNOWN .

why ca n't we teach our children to read , write and UNKNOWN ? 
it 's not that we do n't know how to , because we do . 
it 's that we do n't want to . 
and the reason we do n't want to is that effective education would require us to UNKNOWN some UNKNOWN UNKNOWN UNKNOWN about human nature in general and the human nature of young people in particular , as well as to violate some UNKNOWN UNKNOWN interests . 
these UNKNOWN so UNKNOWN our educational establishment , our media , our politicians , and even our parents that it seems almost UNKNOWN to challenge them . 
here is an example . 
if i were to ask a UNKNOWN of american parents , `` do you wish the UNKNOWN schools to encourage creativity in your children ? '' the UNKNOWN answer would be , `` yes , of course . '' 
but what do we mean , specifically , by `` creativity '' ? 
no one can say . 
in practice , it ends up being UNKNOWN with a `` UNKNOWN '' that UNKNOWN the youngsters ' `` UNKNOWN . '' 
the result is a generation of young people whose UNKNOWN and intellectual incompetence is matched only by their good opinion of themselves . 
the whole notion of `` creativity '' in education was ( and is ) part and parcel of a UNKNOWN UNKNOWN against disciplined instruction , which was ( and is ) regarded as `` UNKNOWN , '' a UNKNOWN and frustration of the UNKNOWN UNKNOWN and the wonderful , if as yet UNKNOWN , UNKNOWN UNKNOWN in the UNKNOWN of all our children . 
it is not surprising that parents find this UNKNOWN UNKNOWN so attractive . 
fortunately , these same parents do want their children to get a decent education as traditionally understood , and they have enough common sense to know what that demands . 
their commitment to `` creativity '' can not survive UNKNOWN UNKNOWN . 
american education 's future will be determined by the degree to which we -- all of us -- allow this common sense to prevail over the UNKNOWN that we also share . 
the education establishment will fight against common sense every UNKNOWN of the way . 
the reasons are complex , but one simple reason ought not to be underestimated . 
`` UNKNOWN education '' ( as it was once called ) is far more interesting and UNKNOWN to teachers than is disciplined instruction . 
it is nice for teachers to think they are engaged in `` UNKNOWN development '' and even UNKNOWN to UNKNOWN those UNKNOWN tests with often disappointing results . 
it also provides teachers with a superior UNKNOWN as a `` profession , '' since they will have passed courses in educational psychology and educational philosophy . 
i myself took such courses in college , thinking i might end up a UNKNOWN . 
they could all fairly be described as `` UNKNOWN '' courses . 
but it is unfair to dump on teachers , as distinct from the educational establishment . 
i know many UNKNOWN and , on the whole , they are seriously committed to UNKNOWN teaching . 
they may not be among the `` best and UNKNOWN '' of their generation -- there are very few such people , by definition . 
but they need not be to do their jobs well . 
yes , we all can remember one or two truly UNKNOWN teachers from our school days . 
but our education UNKNOWN at the hands of those others , who were merely competent and UNKNOWN . 
in this sense , a teacher can be compared to one 's family doctor . 
if he were UNKNOWN , he probably would not be a family doctor in the first place . 
if he is competent and UNKNOWN , he serves us well . 
our teachers are not an important factor in our educational crisis . 
whether they are or are not UNKNOWN is a problem of equity ; it is not an educational problem . 
it is UNKNOWN libel on our teachers to think they would UNKNOWN our children better if only they got a few thousand dollars a year more . 
it is the kind of libel the teachers ' unions do n't mind spreading , for their own narrow purposes . 
it is also the kind of libel politicians find useful , since it helps them strike a friendly UNKNOWN on behalf of an important constituency . 
but there is not one UNKNOWN of evidence that , other things being equal , salary UNKNOWN result in educational UNKNOWN . 
if there were such evidence , you can be sure you would have heard of it . 
if we wish to be serious about american education , we know exactly what to do -- and , just as important , what not to do . 
there are many successful schools scattered throughout this nation , some of them in the UNKNOWN of UNKNOWN , and they are all sending us the same message . 
UNKNOWN , there are the majority of unsuccessful schools , and we know which efforts at educational reform are UNKNOWN UNKNOWN . 
we really do know all we need to know , if only we could UNKNOWN this knowledge into our thinking . 
in this respect , it would be helpful if our political leaders were UNKNOWN , rather than UNKNOWN `` concerned . '' 
they are inevitably inclined to UNKNOWN the conventional UNKNOWN , since this is the least controversial option that is open to them . 
thus at the recent governors ' conference on education , gov. bill clinton of arkansas announced that `` this country needs a comprehensive UNKNOWN policy for children under five . '' 
a comprehensive development policy for governors over 99 would seem to be a more pressing need . 
what gov. clinton is UNKNOWN , in effect , is UNKNOWN the educational system down to the UNKNOWN years . 
whether desirable or not , this is a UNKNOWN program , not an educational program . 
we know that very early exposure to UNKNOWN improves performance in the first grade , but afterward the difference is quickly UNKNOWN away . 
let us sum up what we do know about education and about those education reforms that do work and do n't work : -- `` parental involvement '' is a bad idea . 
parents are too likely to blame schools for the educational UNKNOWN of their children . 
parents should be involved with their children 's education at home , not in school . 
they should see to it that their kids do n't play UNKNOWN ; they should make certain that the children spend enough time doing UNKNOWN ; they should UNKNOWN the report card . 
if parents are UNKNOWN with a school , they should have the option of switching to another . 
-- `` community involvement '' is an even worse idea . 
here , the experience of new york city is UNKNOWN . 
locally elected school boards , especially in our larger cities , become the UNKNOWN of ambitious , generally UNKNOWN , and UNKNOWN UNKNOWN local politicians or UNKNOWN politicians . 
new york is in the process of trying to UNKNOWN itself from a 99-year-old commitment to this system of school UNKNOWN , even as chicago and other cities are moving to institute it . 
-- in most states , increasing expenditures on education , in our current circumstances , will probably make things worse , not better . 
the reason is simple : education takes place in the classroom , where the influence of money is minimal . 
decades of educational research tell us UNKNOWN that even smaller classes have zero effect on the academic performance of the UNKNOWN -- though they may sometimes be desirable for other reasons . 
the new money flows into the already UNKNOWN administrative structure , which UNKNOWN itself UNKNOWN more and more paper work on the teachers . 
there is neither mystery nor UNKNOWN in the fact that as educational expenditures ( in real terms ) have increased sharply in the past UNKNOWN -- we now spend more per UNKNOWN than any other country in the world -- educational performance has declined . 
that is the way the system works . 
-- students should move up the educational UNKNOWN as their academic potential allows . 
no student should be permitted to be UNKNOWN from UNKNOWN school without having UNKNOWN the 9 UNKNOWN 's at the level that UNKNOWN 99 years ago . 
this means `` tracking , '' whose main purpose is less to permit the UNKNOWN youngsters to UNKNOWN ( though that is clearly desirable ) than to ensure that the less UNKNOWN get the necessary UNKNOWN for further study or for entering the modern world of work . 
the notion that tracking is somehow `` undemocratic '' is UNKNOWN . 
the purpose of education is to encourage young men and women to realize their full academic potential . 
no one in his right mind actually believes that we all have an equal academic potential . 
-- it is generally desirable to use older UNKNOWN -- many of them , UNKNOWN , out of print -- rather than newer ones . 
the latter are UNKNOWN , UNKNOWN , often UNKNOWN UNKNOWN , and at best UNKNOWN . 
they are based on dubious psychological and UNKNOWN UNKNOWN rather than on educational experience . 
one of the reasons american students do so poorly in UNKNOWN tests , as compared with british , french , german or japanese students , is the influence of the `` new UNKNOWN '' on american UNKNOWN and teaching methods . 
anyone who wants to appreciate just how UNKNOWN this situation is -- with students who ca n't add or UNKNOWN `` learning '' the UNKNOWN basis of UNKNOWN theory -- should read the article by UNKNOWN nelson ( himself a recent UNKNOWN major at harvard ) in the november american UNKNOWN . 
-- most important of all , schools should have principals with a large measure of authority over the faculty , the curriculum , and all matters of student discipline . 
study after study -- the most recent from the UNKNOWN institution -- tells us that the best schools are those that are free of outside UNKNOWN and are UNKNOWN by a powerful head . 
with that authority , of course , goes an UNKNOWN UNKNOWN . 
schools that are structured in this way produce students with higher morale and superior academic performance . 
this is a fact -- though , in view of all the UNKNOWN that are UNKNOWN by this fact , it is not surprising that one UNKNOWN so little about it .

international business machines corp. unveiled a broad strategy to tackle the biggest problem that manufacturers face when computerizing their operations : most machines ca n't talk to each other . 
the company unveiled more than 99 products , mostly software , that are designed to integrate the three areas of a manufacturing operation -- the plant floor , design operations and production planning . 
the aim , ultimately , is to increase the flow of information into a manufacturer 's main computer network for use in business planning , marketing and other operations . 
manufacturers have already spent so heavily on UNKNOWN that they are one of the computer industry 's leading revenue sources . 
but many manufacturers find that communication between different computers has been UNKNOWN nearly impossible by the UNKNOWN of computer UNKNOWN used by different machines , including UNKNOWN and machine tools .

consultants have said that it will take a while for all the pieces of the ibm strategy to fall into place , even though the specific products ibm unveiled will generally be available by the end of the first quarter . 
sam albert , a consultant in UNKNOWN , n.y. , said that in the past ibm has developed broad software strategies only for problems that UNKNOWN industry lines . 
he said he believes ibm 's decision to invest this sort of effort into a single industry showed that it was getting serious about understanding customers ' problems and was n't just selling technology . 
he said he expects ibm to unveil similar strategies for other industries in coming months . 
ibm 's push is also unusual in its approach to marketing . 
rather than just send out marketing people to UNKNOWN on customers ' doors , ibm is making several hundred of its own manufacturing people available to discuss specific needs . 
ibm 's manufacturing staff also will be able to provide software that ibm has developed UNKNOWN and will be able to form teams with a customer to jointly solve manufacturing problems . 
ibm can obviously bring its expertise to bear on problems related to computer manufacturing , but it could also help customers on software to deal with such things as changes in engineering documents . 
`` we may not have every manufacturing problem , but we have most , '' said george UNKNOWN , ibm 's top marketing official .

the tougher new regulations under the savings-and-loan bailout law are accelerating the thrift industry 's shrinking act . 
largely to meet tougher new capital requirements , thrifts reduced their assets $ 99.9 billion in august , by selling such assets as mortgage-backed securities and loans . 
industry assets as of aug. 99 were $ 9.99 trillion , the lowest since august 9999 . 
as thrifts sell assets to improve their UNKNOWN ratio , as required under the new law passed in august , they must also reduce liabilities , such as deposits . 
as interest rates paid UNKNOWN were lowered , thrift withdrawals exceeded deposits by $ 9.9 billion , not including interest credited to accounts . 
it was the third consecutive month in which thrifts shed assets to increase the size of their capital in UNKNOWN to their assets , the office of thrift supervision said . 
the asset UNKNOWN was particularly concentrated in several large california institutions . 
`` the UNKNOWN of the thrift industry is well under way , '' said UNKNOWN UNKNOWN , an industry consultant in UNKNOWN , va . 
`` this suggests the bailout law is having a more dramatic effect than anyone would have UNKNOWN so soon . '' 
james UNKNOWN , an economist with the office of thrift supervision , also attributed some of the UNKNOWN to seasonal factors . 
`` august is a month when people are paying school tuition , '' he said . 
`` that and adjustment to the new law were the biggest factors in the industry . '' 
not including thrifts under government conservatorship , UNKNOWN reduced their assets by $ 99.9 billion from the previous month , and deposit UNKNOWN totaled $ 9.9 billion .

the estimates of real gross national product prepared by the bureau of economic analysis in the department of commerce significantly UNKNOWN the rate of economic growth . 
since the bureau 's estimates for the business sector provide the UNKNOWN for the productivity ratios calculated by the department of labor , underestimated growth rates UNKNOWN depress official productivity statistics . 
if this UNKNOWN is correct , it has important implications for UNKNOWN policies : it may lower the sense of urgency behind efforts to enact tax incentives and other measures to increase the rate of growth in productivity and real gnp . 
it would also affect the perceptions of the board of governors of the federal reserve system , and the informed public generally , as to what UNKNOWN a reasonable degree of price stability . 
in the early 9999s , i predicted a significant acceleration in productivity growth over the rest of the decade . 
this forecast was based on the apparent reversal of most of the negative forces -- such as UNKNOWN changes , the oil shock and accelerating inflation -- that had reduced productivity gains in the 9999s . 
there has indeed been more than a one percentage point improvement in productivity growth since 9999 . 
but i had expected more , which is one reason i began looking at evidence suggesting defects in the official output estimates . 
the evidence does not clearly support the view that the downward bias in output growth has become greater during the 9999-99 period , but all i am claiming is that the growth trend is UNKNOWN . 
( it is , however , possible , that further study will reveal increasing bias . ) 
this bias is in no way UNKNOWN . 
the UNKNOWN of growth is due largely to the conservative UNKNOWN adopted to deal with UNKNOWN in basic economic data . 
the first of three major sources of error is the use of labor UNKNOWN estimates ( mainly employment or hours ) instead of output estimates for those sectors , such as governments , paid household services and private non-profit institutions , where there are difficulties in UNKNOWN output data . 
this means that no UNKNOWN is made for possible increases in output per unit of labor . 
in an UNKNOWN program in which the labor department does estimate output per employee for more than two-thirds of federal UNKNOWN employees , it found an average annual rate of productivity improvement of 9.9 % during the 9999s . 
even if it is assumed that productivity rose no more than half as quickly in the rest of the UNKNOWN sector , this labor department estimate indicates a downward bias in the real gnp estimates of 9.9 percentage point a year , on average . 
the federal productivity UNKNOWN use labor UNKNOWN , rather than output , data for their calculations of half of private financial and service industries as well . 
independent estimates of output in those industries , including one by the department of labor for banking , suggests that productivity in finance and services appears to have risen by an average of at least 9.9 % a year between 9999 and 9999 . 
because finance and services contribute 99 % to final business product , missing these productivity improvements UNKNOWN the overall growth rate by 9.99 % a year . 
the second source of error in growth statistics is the use of inappropriate UNKNOWN to adjust for price changes . 
i estimate that these UNKNOWN as detailed by martin n. UNKNOWN and robert j. gordon add a further 9.99 percentage point to the downward bias in the growth rate of real business product . 
finally , the official estimates UNKNOWN growth because they make inadequate UNKNOWN for improvements in quality of goods and services . 
in 9999 , a new price index for computers adjusted for changes in performance UNKNOWN was introduced , and that resulted in a significantly larger increase in real outlays for durable goods than the earlier estimates had showed . 
since then , further research argues that failure to take account of quality improvements has contributed a total of at least 9.99 percentage point to the downward bias in the growth rate . 
in sum , the UNKNOWN UNKNOWN above indicate a 9.9 percentage point UNKNOWN in growth of total real gnp . 
for the private domestic business economy , the bias was a bit over 9.9 percentage point . 
in other words , the growth rates of both total gnp and real private business product per labor hour have been underestimated by about 99 % . 
mr. UNKNOWN is professor UNKNOWN of economics at george washington university . 
he is UNKNOWN of `` personal productivity : how to increase your satisfaction in living '' ( UNKNOWN sharp , 9999 ) .

but individuals familiar with the generally successful drexel talks say the firm is meeting resistance from some big states , including new jersey , new york , california , pennsylvania , connecticut and missouri . 
officials in some of these states say they do n't want to simply accept the settlements offered by drexel . 
they question if drexel is getting easier treatment than the many small UNKNOWN firms whose brokerage licenses are routinely revoked . 
drexel has to settle with state securities regulators in the wake of its criminal guilty plea and a related civil settlement with the securities and exchange commission that includes payment of $ 999 million in penalties . 
these stem from a two-year federal investigation of insider trading and securities fraud on wall street . 
ohio , the district of columbia , tennessee and illinois have been less UNKNOWN to drexel than the other six states , but nonetheless have refused to settle so far , say those familiar with the discussions . 
drexel says it does n't expect any of its state brokerage licenses will be revoked , and even if some are , its securities business would n't be directly hurt . 
it already has sold its retail , or UNKNOWN , brokerage network ; securities firms do n't need brokerage licenses for UNKNOWN activities such as investment banking . 
still , if nothing else , a revoked brokerage license could be a burden because it must be disclosed in many of the transactions in which drexel could be involved . 
securities regulators UNKNOWN drexel for its energetic effort , led by UNKNOWN general counsel saul s. cohen , to settle its legal problems with the states . 
but they disagree about the message these settlements give to the public . 
`` there was a lot of internal debate about that specific issue , '' said susan bryant , oklahoma 's chief securities regulator and president of the north american securities administrators association , which drafted a UNKNOWN settlement plan for the states with drexel . 
the question , she said , is whether drexel should be allowed to pay and move on , or `` whether you should ( simply ) revoke the license when someone is convicted of a felony . '' 
while ms. bryant 's state went ahead and accepted drexel 's settlement offer of $ 99,999 , she said : `` i do n't have any argument with those who came to different UNKNOWN . 
i can see both sides . '' 
similarly , alfred UNKNOWN , new hampshire 's director of securities regulation , said his state had n't received any complaints about drexel , so it really could n't press the issue . 
still , `` i understand the reasons '' that other states are holding out , he said . 
mr. cohen , the drexel general counsel , said , `` i do n't think , as we say in investment banking , that ` by the end of the day ' we 'll be losing any licenses . '' 
asked about states that are taking a hard line , he said , `` there are states that have asked for additional information , which we are providing to them . '' 
mr. cohen said more than $ 9.9 million has been paid to 99 states and that drexel still expects to pay out a total of $ 99.9 million . 
by the end of this week , drexel should have another three to four settlements , mr. cohen said . 
`` the rate we 're going , i think that by the end of the month , we 're looking to have a total of 99 to 99 , '' he said . 
that total would be important for drexel .

for the six months ended sept. 99 , daiwa reported UNKNOWN ( parent company ) net income of 99.99 billion yen ( $ 999.9 million ) on revenue of 999.99 billion yen ( $ 9.99 billion ) .

several observers interpreted mr. dozen 's appointment as an attempt by daiwa to make its international operations more profitable while preparing the firm for the effects of the continuing deregulation of japan 's domestic markets , which should mean increased competition . 
all of japan 's so-called big four securities firms -- nomura securities co. ltd. , the world 's largest , nikko securities co. ltd. , yamaichi securities co. ltd. and daiwa -- have suffered setbacks in their attempts to break into foreign markets . 
while they have moved to the UNKNOWN in underwriting fixed-income securities in the UNKNOWN market -- mostly for japanese firms -- they have been only marginally profitable , if at all , in the u.s. . 
american institutional investors have never had a large appetite for japanese equities . 
and while the japanese have stepped up their purchases of u.s. shares in the past several months , they have shown themselves in the past to be UNKNOWN investors . 
at the same time , daiwa and its UNKNOWN have faced stiff competition from UNKNOWN american competitors that have prevented them from building strong links to u.s. corporations and institutional investors . 
mr. dozen knows these problems UNKNOWN . 
when he arrived in the u.s. in 9999 -- the start of an UNKNOWN tour -- he tried selling japanese UNKNOWN bonds to u.s. investors .

in an interview a few months ago , he UNKNOWN how after some training at salomon brothers inc. , he successfully bid for the opportunity to sell UNKNOWN of 99 u.s. corporate bond issues . 
but he could n't sell any . 
`` japanese stock salesmen selling american bonds ? 
maybe it 's crazy , '' he said .

mr. dozen said daiwa 's UNKNOWN were its large capital base , its influential position in the tokyo market and its links to japanese corporations and institutional investors .

crude oil futures prices fell further as analysts and traders said opec oil producers are n't putting the UNKNOWN on output ahead of the traditionally weak first quarter . 
in trading on the new york mercantile exchange , the u.s. benchmark west texas intermediate crude fell 99 cents a barrel to $ 99.99 for december delivery . 
petroleum products prices also declined . 
analysts pointed to reports that the organization of petroleum exporting countries is producing substantially more than its official limit of 99.9 million barrels a day , with some accounts putting the 99-nation group 's output as high as 99 million barrels a day . 
that level of production did n't take its toll on futures prices for the fourth quarter , when demand is traditionally strong . 
but because first-quarter demand is normally the UNKNOWN of the year , several market participants say , opec production will have to decline to keep prices from UNKNOWN further . 
the group plans to meet in a month to discuss production strategy for early 9999 . 
with prices already headed lower , news of a series of explosions at a major phillips petroleum co. chemical facility on the houston ship channel also was bearish for prices . 
even though such facilities use a relatively small amount of crude , analysts say , now the facility wo n't need any , at a time of already high availability . 
the phillips plant makes polyethylene , UNKNOWN and other plastic products .

this activity produced small rallies , which in turn attracted new short selling . 
mr. savaiko noted that copper had a steep fall in spite of a weak dollar , which would normally support the u.s. copper market . 
such support usually comes from arbitragers who use a strong british pound to buy copper in new york . 
`` the sell-off would probably have been worse if the dollar had been strong , '' he said .

mr. savaiko believes that if copper falls below the bottom of this range the next significant support level will be about $ 9.99 .

here are auction details : 
rates are determined by the difference between the purchase price and face value . 
thus , higher bidding UNKNOWN the investor 's return while lower bidding widens it .

manville , having rid itself of asbestos , now sells UNKNOWN , forest products , minerals and industrial goods . 
UNKNOWN stuff it 's not . 
but manville 's ownership is unusual , and it has caught the eye of some UNKNOWN -- and patient -- investors . 
the UNKNOWN concern , which emerged from bankruptcy-law proceedings late last year , is controlled by the manville personal injury settlement trust . 
the trust , which owns 99 % of manville 's stock on a fully diluted basis , is a separate legal entity that is settling claims with asbestos victims . 
when and if the trust runs out of cash -- which seems increasingly likely -- it will need to convert its manville stock to cash . 
but as an 99 % owner , if it tried to sell much of its stock in the market , it would likely depress the price of its shares . 
some investors say there is a good chance that the trust will , instead , seek to convert the company 's shares to cash , in some sort of friendly restructuring that would n't involve just UNKNOWN stock on the market . 
`` their principal asset is manville common stock , '' says jeffrey UNKNOWN , who runs UNKNOWN associates , an investment fund that owns manville shares . 
`` if they tried to sell , they 'd be UNKNOWN their own UNKNOWN . 
what makes the most sense is to find someone who wants to buy the whole company or cause a recapitalization of all shares . '' 
the trust is n't commenting on when it might need to UNKNOWN its manville stock . 
however , the trust 's cash flow from investments is far short of its payments to asbestos victims . 
its cash and liquid securities fell by $ 999 million in the first six months of 9999 . 
the trust also will receive $ 99 million a year starting in 9999 on a bond it holds from manville . 
and , beginning in 9999 , it will have a claim on as much as 99 % of manville 's annual net income . 
even so , the trust would seem to be facing a cash crunch . 
as of june 99 , it had settled only about 99,999 of the 99,999 received claims from asbestos victims , for an average of $ 99,999 each . 
( the average should drop over time , since the most expensive claims are being settled first ) . 
and as of UNKNOWN , settled but UNKNOWN claims amounted to $ 999 million -- more than half the trust 's total of $ 999 million in cash and marketable securities . 
`` at some point , we 're going to need an UNKNOWN of funds , '' a person close to the trust says . 
even before then , the trust may be eager to UNKNOWN manville stock . 
it does n't pay a dividend , and this trust needs income . 
moreover , with 99 % of its assets tied up in manville , the trust is badly in need of diversification . 
`` obviously , a diversified portfolio would have less risk , '' the person close to the trust says . 
manville itself does n't rule out a restructuring . 
though the ink is barely dry on its new , UNKNOWN law structure , bill UNKNOWN , manville 's head of investor relations , says the company is continually UNKNOWN `` whether there is a better way to be structured . 
we understand that the trust is ultimately going to need to sell some of our shares , '' he says . 
of course , one option would be for manville to buy out the trust 's shares -- which would do little to benefit public stockholders . 
but the trust , in most cases , is UNKNOWN from seeking a buyer for only its shares before november 9999 . 
and both the trust and manville are seeking to avoid the bad publicity that , in the asbestos era , UNKNOWN the manville name . 
thus , analysts say , the trust is unlikely to do anything that would hurt manville 's other shareholders . 
`` this is a rare case of a company with a big majority holder which will probably act in the interests of the minority holders , '' one investor says . 
even if there is no restructuring , manville seems to be attractive long-term . 
its stock , at 9 9\/9 , trades at about 9 9\/9 times estimated 9999 earnings -- an UNKNOWN low multiple for a company with UNKNOWN customers . 
mr. UNKNOWN says 99 % of revenues are tied to construction . 
analysts predict little or no near-term growth . 
they are , nonetheless , high on manville 's management . 
`` it 's one of the best in the business , '' says salomon brothers analyst stephen UNKNOWN . 
and he says manville has the financial flexibility to buy other companies at the best possible moment when other UNKNOWN firms are hurting and selling cheap . 
with a conservative UNKNOWN ratio of UNKNOWN -- and $ 999 million in cash -- manville is indeed actively on the UNKNOWN . 
so far , as a UNKNOWN UNKNOWN , manville has n't bought much . 
paul UNKNOWN , an analyst at UNKNOWN & UNKNOWN , says , `` even though they have borrowing power , they have been disciplined about acquisitions . '' 
and mr. UNKNOWN says that with 99 % of its stock in friendly hands , manville is the rare publicly traded company that can ignore short-term stock fluctuations and plan for the long haul .

in composite trading on the new york stock exchange yesterday , santa fe pacific closed at $ 99.999 , down 99 cents . 
santa fe pacific realty is a major california land and building owner whose prime properties include 9,999 UNKNOWN acres in the san francisco bay area , and several office sites . 
a spokesman said the properties survived without significant damage in last week 's northern california earthquake .
