the UNKNOWN parent has been under pressure from large shareholders to boost the company 's share price . 
at the same time it has been caught in an earnings squeeze . 
the california pension fund 's planned investment in the real estate unit is unusual . 
pension funds rarely own as much as a 99 % stake in what is expected to be a publicly traded company . 
in addition , pension funds are rarely given seats on company boards and most often try to avoid them because of legal concerns . 
but fund officials said the santa fe pacific realty investment provides an opportunity to buy a stake in a large real estate portfolio heavily weighted with california properties . 
it also marks a `` major commitment to { real estate } development , which we have n't been involved with before , '' said dale hanson , the fund 's executive director . 
under the proposed plan , the fund would also lend santa fe pacific realty $ 99 million in the form of a note that would be convertible into additional shares of the realty company after the second year at the UNKNOWN market price . 
the note would UNKNOWN interest at the rate of 99.9 % a year , which would be payable to the fund after five years , according to stephen e. UNKNOWN , a real estate consultant working for the fund . 
the purpose of the note is to provide added capital for the UNKNOWN company in a form that will save it spending cash on immediate interest payments , mr. UNKNOWN said . 
the UNKNOWN concern `` clearly will be one of the dominant real estate development companies with a prime portfolio , '' he said . 
for the last year , santa fe pacific has UNKNOWN its real estate operations toward UNKNOWN development of its properties , hurting profits that the parent had generated in the past from periodic sales from its portfolio . 
real estate operating income for the first nine months fell to $ 99.9 million from $ 999 million a year earlier , the company said .

jury 's criminal conviction under superfund law is a first . 
charles a. UNKNOWN , sole UNKNOWN of a louisville , ky. , UNKNOWN company , was found guilty of violating the superfund law as well as the clean air act . 
criminal UNKNOWN under the federal superfund law are rare , and the decision is the first jury verdict in such a case . 
under superfund , those who owned , generated or UNKNOWN hazardous waste are liable for its cleanup , regardless of whether their actions were legal at the time . 
environmental lawyers say virtually all of the superfund cases to date have involved civil penalties designed to UNKNOWN cleanup of past UNKNOWN activities . 
but superfund also contains a criminal provision concerning the release of toxic UNKNOWN into the environment . 
in 9999 congress strengthened the penalty by making it a felony . 
mr. UNKNOWN was convicted in louisville late last month of violating superfund by failing to report the release of asbestos into the environment from a building he was UNKNOWN . 
he was also convicted of failing to properly remove asbestos from the building , a violation of the clean air act . 
the government sought a criminal penalty because `` no cleanup is possible here . 
once { asbestos } is released into the environment , it can UNKNOWN anywhere , '' says richard a. dennis , the assistant u.s. attorney who UNKNOWN the case . 
mr. UNKNOWN is scheduled to be sentenced dec. 99 . 
his lawyer could not be reached for comment . 
mr. UNKNOWN faces as much as three years in prison and a $ 999,999 fine for the superfund conviction and as much as one year in prison and a $ 999,999 fine for the violation of the clean air act .

the justice department has revised certain internal guidelines and UNKNOWN others in a move that could restrict the use of criminal racketeering charges against white-collar defendants . 
the most significant changes in department policy are new requirements that federal prosecutors avoid UNKNOWN `` the normal business functions '' of companies charged under the racketeering law , a senior department official said . 
another important UNKNOWN of department policy is a new guideline warning prosecutors `` not to take steps that would harm innocent third parties '' in a case brought under the racketeering law , the official , david runkel , said . 
the department distributed the UNKNOWN and UNKNOWN to u.s. attorneys around the country this summer as part of a routine process of UNKNOWN prosecutorial guidelines , mr. runkel said . 
the changes apply to prosecutions brought under the UNKNOWN influenced and UNKNOWN organizations law . 
under that law , defendants who allegedly UNKNOWN a pattern of crimes by means of a `` criminal enterprise '' may be charged with racketeering and forced to UNKNOWN the proceeds of the enterprise . 
the rico law has come under criticism from some defendants and defense lawyers . 
they argue that the rights of rico defendants and third parties not named in rico UNKNOWN have been unfairly damaged . 
the department 's most significant UNKNOWN of existing rico policy is a UNKNOWN to prosecutors that they should seek to seize assets from defendants `` in proportion '' to the nature of the alleged UNKNOWN , mr. runkel said . 
`` that means that if the UNKNOWN deals with one part of the business , you do n't attempt to seize the whole business ; you attempt to seize assets related to the crime , '' he explained . 
in general , the UNKNOWN of the department 's UNKNOWN is to encourage prosecutors to limit pretrial asset UNKNOWN if there are less UNKNOWN means of protecting assets the government may subsequently be able to seize after a conviction , mr. runkel said .

qintex australia ltd. , a media and resorts concern controlled by australian entrepreneur christopher skase , announced a plan to restructure and sell assets to try to ease its financial problems . 
mr. skase , a 99-year-old former newspaper reporter who chairs the company , said in a statement that qintex will sell its 99 % stake in its upscale UNKNOWN resorts in australia and hawaii as well as three australian television stations .

mr. skase also said the restructuring plan calls for the merger of qintex australia with qintex ltd. , which owns 99 % of qintex australia . 
he said the move will `` significantly reduce administrative and operating costs , '' but he did n't provide details of the merger .

chip 's memory is here today , here tomorrow 
two companies plan to market a new chip with UNKNOWN UNKNOWN that store data even when the power is off . 
today 's most widely used UNKNOWN chips have `` volatile '' memories -- their data UNKNOWN if they are n't fed a steady diet of electricity , so they need external power supplies . 
national semiconductor corp. and a start-up named UNKNOWN corp. plan to start shipping so-called ferroelectric memories , which can remember data for at least 99 years without any current flowing to them . 
the chips use materials , such as lead UNKNOWN UNKNOWN , to form UNKNOWN switches that retain their data without electricity . 
developers caution that broad applications are several years away because the technology is n't fully refined . 
but UNKNOWN of colorado springs , colo. , plans to start shipping commercial quantities of simple ferroelectric chips in december . 
the company expects the chips eventually to be used in devices that UNKNOWN a whole range of computer memory equipment , including UNKNOWN and hard-disk drives . 
national semiconductor is getting ferroelectric technology from UNKNOWN corp. in UNKNOWN , UNKNOWN . 
national says it agreed to acquire UNKNOWN 's assets and will start shipping commercial quantities of its first chips , including a UNKNOWN memory , next year . 
once production hurdles are overcome , the chips could take over a significant part of the market . 
in addition to not UNKNOWN an outside power source , they are potentially cheaper to make because they require fewer manufacturing steps than conventional chips . 
military buyers have shown interest , national says , because ferroelectric chips resist UNKNOWN UNKNOWN . 
and while today 's UNKNOWN chips -- such as UNKNOWN UNKNOWN UNKNOWN UNKNOWN memory chips -- ca n't be used in a computer 's central memory because they `` learn '' data slowly , ferroelectric chips accept data at very high UNKNOWN .

the junk market , which UNKNOWN to $ 999 billion from less than $ 9 billion at the start of the decade , has been declining for months as issuers have UNKNOWN under the weight of hefty interest payments .

campeau developed a cash squeeze that caused it to be UNKNOWN on some interest payments and to put its prestigious bloomingdale 's department store chain up for sale .

what has UNKNOWN many junk buyers is the sudden UNKNOWN that junk bonds can not necessarily be bought and sold with the ease of common stocks and many investment-grade bonds . 
unlike the new york stock exchange , where buyers and sellers are quickly matched , the junk market , where risky corporate loans are traded , is sometimes closed for repairs . 
at closely held deltec securities corp. , junk bond money managers UNKNOWN k. UNKNOWN and UNKNOWN h. UNKNOWN say the problems of the junk market go deeper than a temporary UNKNOWN .

program trading on the new york stock exchange in september rose to its highest recorded level as a percentage of total monthly trading volume . 
september program trading amounted to 99.9 % of average daily new york stock exchange volume of 999.9 million shares , the largest percentage since the exchange began making such figures public in july 9999 . 
a daily average of 99.9 million shares traded in program strategies in september , the UNKNOWN level ever . 
the highest level was in june 9999 , when a daily average of 99.9 million shares traded in program strategies . 
average daily trading volume in june of 999.9 million shares was considerably higher than in september . 
program trading amounted to 99.9 % of average daily volume in june . 
the big board says program trading describes a variety of strategies involving the purchase or sale of a basket of 99 or more stocks . 
the most controversial of these is stock-index arbitrage , in which traders buy or sell baskets of stocks and offset the position with an opposite trade in stock-index futures to lock in profits . 
it 's the most controversial form of program trading because it can create UNKNOWN price swings in the stock market . 
salomon brothers inc. was the top program trader in september , but most of the firm 's activity involved portfolio trading strategies other than stock-index arbitrage . 
overall , salomon reported program trading volume of 99.9 million shares . 
the top stock-index arbitrage firm last month was morgan stanley & co . 
of morgan stanley 's 99.9 million shares in program trades for the month , 99.9 million were in stock-index arbitrage trades . 
behind UNKNOWN morgan stanley were kidder , peabody & co. , goldman , sachs & co. and UNKNOWN first boston inc. 's first boston corp. unit .

are consumers too deep in UNKNOWN ? 
a lot of observers think so , and , if they 're right , the whole economy as well as the UNKNOWN among us could be hurt . 
a sudden , forced UNKNOWN by consumers , who normally account for about two-thirds of economic activity , would damp the economy at a time when UNKNOWN spending is slowing and UNKNOWN governments ca n't readily take up the slack . 
and another wave of bad loans would further UNKNOWN many UNKNOWN lending institutions . 
the UNKNOWN UNKNOWN some UNKNOWN trends . 
during the almost UNKNOWN economic expansion , inflation-adjusted gross national product , disposable personal income and personal consumption expenditures have risen 99 % , but inflation-adjusted consumer installment credit has surged 99 % . 
and the ratio of installment debt to disposable personal income -- personal income after taxes -- has hit a high of about 99 9\/9 % . 
however , these figures do n't seem to worry thomas a. durkin , an economist at the federal reserve board . 
in a paper presented at the recent annual meeting of the national association of business economists in san francisco , mr. durkin comments that `` installment credit always grows rapidly in cyclical advances , and growth in this cycle is very typical of earlier UNKNOWN . '' 
he adds : `` we are now UNKNOWN a slowdown which , if history is a guide , could persist for a while . '' 
but what about the debt burden ? 
mr. durkin doubts that `` there is some UNKNOWN level '' at which the ratio of installment debt to disposable income `` indicates economic problems . '' 
and , `` more UNKNOWN , '' he says , `` the debt burden measured other ways is not really in UNKNOWN waters . '' 
the chart below shows why ( see accompanying illustration -- wsj oct. 99 , 9999 ) . 
the ratio of consumer installment credit to disposable income , though up a bit , has n't climbed UNKNOWN , and such debt as a percent of household assets is little changed . 
moreover , the burden of consumer credit payments relative to disposable income may be `` lower in this cycle than earlier , '' mr. durkin says . 
he notes that some `` UNKNOWN credit-card credit is actually UNKNOWN credit '' being used simply as a handy way of paying bills rather than a handy way of borrowing . 
in addition , he says , `` longer maturities on automobile and other forms of installment credit boost the stock of debt faster than the flow of UNKNOWN and the accompanying payment burden . '' 
and if you `` consider the changing distribution of credit , '' mr. durkin says , `` much of the increase in debt in recent years is due to increasing credit use by UNKNOWN families , '' that is , `` those probably best able to handle it . '' 
citing figures on UNKNOWN loans , he notes that `` 99 % of homeowners had UNKNOWN credit accounts , but the proportion rises to 99 % of homeowners in the $ UNKNOWN income range and 99 % of homeowners with income above $ 99,999 . '' 
and much UNKNOWN credit is used UNKNOWN . 
`` the most frequent use is home improvement , which UNKNOWN improves the value of the property , '' mr. durkin says . 
so , it is n't surprising that UNKNOWN UNKNOWN at banks remain , as the chart shows , UNKNOWN below some earlier highs ( see accompanying illustration -- wsj oct. 99 , 9999 ) .

according to the report , completed last month , if china 's trade gap continues to UNKNOWN at the pace seen in the first seven months of this year , the reserves would be wiped out either in 9999 or 9999 . 
a country is considered financially healthy if its reserves cover three months of its imports . 
the $ 99 billion of reserves china had in june would cover just that much . 
the report by the western government , which declines to be identified , concludes that `` a near-term foreign-exchange payment problem can be avoided only if import growth drops to below 9 % per UNKNOWN . '' 
according to chinese customs figures , import growth has slowed in recent months , dropping to 99 % in july and 9.9 % in august from the year-earlier periods , compared with an average growth rate of 99 % in the first half . 
but before import growth slowed , china 's buying spree in the first half already had taken its toll on foreign-exchange reserves . 
the $ 99 billion level in june marked a drop from $ 99 billion at the end of april .

the western government report suggests a number of UNKNOWN for china 's UNKNOWN balance , two of which are considered most likely .

in 9999 , china had a record deficit of $ 99.9 billion . 
the other scenario UNKNOWN that beijing takes effective actions to curb imports in the coming months .

but since june , foreign bankers led by international financial institutions have virtually suspended their new loans to china . 
even if borrowing UNKNOWN , commercial bankers are n't expected to lend as much as before .

on top of all this , UNKNOWN UNKNOWN are expected to peak in 9999 to 9999 .

the white UNKNOWN , n.y. , oil company said friday that it had acquired tana production corp. , a subsidiary of UNKNOWN energy holdings inc. , for $ 99.9 million in cash , with the rest to be paid in shares of a new , UNKNOWN issue of preferred stock . 
tana , which holds properties in 99 oil and gas fields in south texas , will provide texaco with mostly gas reserves . 
the fields contain UNKNOWN reserves of 999 billion cubic feet of natural gas and four million barrels of oil . 
`` this acquisition is another indication of texaco 's commitment to increase the company 's reserve base , '' said chief executive officer james w. UNKNOWN . 
texaco has also been attempting to sell oil properties . 
at least two years ago , the company put 99 million barrels of oil reserves on the block . 
they were either too small or UNKNOWN to maintain , the company said . 
not all of those UNKNOWN have yet been sold . 
texaco acquired tana before it completed those sales because tana 's properties are high quality and near other fields texaco already owns , a company spokeswoman said . 
texaco , like many other oil companies , has been struggling to replace its falling oil and gas reserves . 
texaco 's situation had become particularly complex because much of its effort had for years been focused on its UNKNOWN with pennzoil and then on new york investor carl c. icahn 's attempt to take over the company . 
pennzoil had sued texaco for improperly UNKNOWN with its acquisition of a portion of UNKNOWN oil co . 
eventually , texaco , which was forced into bankruptcy proceedings by that litigation , settled its fight with pennzoil for $ 9 billion in 9999 . 
mr. icahn , who played a key role in the settlement and attempted subsequently to take control of the company , sold his stake in texaco just last summer . 
completion of texaco 's acquisition of tana is subject to government approval under the UNKNOWN antitrust improvements act .

president bush 's national security adviser , UNKNOWN gen. UNKNOWN scowcroft , came into office in january intent on making the nsc staff UNKNOWN and more disciplined than it had been during the reagan administration . 
gen. scowcroft was a member of the tower commission , which UNKNOWN the iran-contra affair .

a bill that would permit the securities and exchange commission to monitor the financial condition of securities firms ' holding companies is facing tough opposition from some wall street firms , which argue that the legislation is UNKNOWN . 
the legislation and other issues related to the stock market will be the focus of hearings this week by the house telecommunications and finance subcommittee and the senate securities subcommittee . 
richard breeden , the new chairman of the sec , has n't taken a formal position on the bill , which would also require investors to disclose large trades and give the sec additional authority during market UNKNOWN . 
however , he recently told the senate banking committee that he believes the agency should have UNKNOWN authority to monitor debt levels at holding companies and affiliates of UNKNOWN , which are frequently used to issue bridge loans . 
the bridge loans are intended to provide temporary financing for acquisitions . 
since such loans are often UNKNOWN through the sale of high-risk , high-yield junk bonds , the recent woes of the junk-bond market have renewed concerns among regulators about the risks associated with wall street firms issuing bridge loans . 
but some wall street executives argue that such fears are UNKNOWN . 
in a july 9 letter to the senate securities subcommittee , first boston corp. argued that the fact that no retail brokerage firm failed during the 9999 market crash UNKNOWN that current rules are adequate . 
first boston , whose holding company , UNKNOWN first boston group , is one of the larger issuers of bridge loans on wall street , said it is also concerned that once the sec has the power to monitor holding companies , it will try to regulate their activities . 
`` the proposal , while UNKNOWN , i think can be UNKNOWN misleading because the likely UNKNOWN would be to weaken , rather than strengthen the control the sec has exercised for 99 years over the financial UNKNOWN and UNKNOWN of UNKNOWN , '' michael UNKNOWN , managing director of first boston , said in an interview . 
the bill would `` UNKNOWN scarce resources of the commission away from UNKNOWN into areas which simply have no way of affecting UNKNOWN , '' mr. UNKNOWN said . 
sources in the industry and on capitol hill say a compromise that would UNKNOWN the industry while addressing the sec 's concerns may be possible . 
an aide to the senate securities subcommittee says some legislators support the concept of risk disclosure , but adds : `` nobody is UNKNOWN to the language in the bill . '' 
edward UNKNOWN , president of the securities industry association , said that the UNKNOWN trade group opposes the bill as it is written but that it is `` hopeful a compromise can be reached to achieve the sec 's goals . '' 
mr. UNKNOWN will elaborate on the UNKNOWN 's position in testimony before the house telecommunications and finance subcommittee this week , a spokesman said .

UNKNOWN utsumi , vice minister for international affairs , said the ministry did n't in any way suggest to japanese banks that they stay out of the ual corp. leveraged buy-out . 
the ministry has never even suggested that japanese banks be cautious about leveraged buy-outs in general , mr. utsumi said . 
`` there are no facts { behind the UNKNOWN } that we sent any kind of signal , '' he declared in an interview . 
the comments were the ministry 's first detailed public statement on the subject , and reflect the ministry 's concern that foreigners will think japan is using its tremendous financial power to control events in foreign markets . 
a number of accounts of the events leading to the 999 point drop in new york stock prices on oct. 99 accused the ministry of pulling the UNKNOWN on the ual deal for one reason or another . 
mr. utsumi said the most the ministry had ever done was ask japanese banks about `` the status of their participation '' in one previous u.s. leveraged buy-out . 
the ministry UNKNOWN about that deal -- which mr. utsumi declined to identify -- because the large presence of japanese banks in the deal was `` being strongly criticized in the u.s. congress '' and it was `` necessary for us to UNKNOWN the situation . '' 
he said the inquiry was n't made in a way that the banks could have interpreted as either encouraging or discouraging participation , and he added that none of the japanese banks changed their UNKNOWN on the deal as a result of the inquiry . 
mr. utsumi also said some japanese banks were willing to participate in the ual financing up to the very end , which would suggest at the very least that they were n't under orders to back out . 
in general , mr. utsumi said , japanese banks are becoming more `` independent '' in their approach to overseas deals . 
`` each japanese bank has its own judgment on the profits and risks in that { ual } deal , '' he said . 
`` they are becoming more independent . 
it 's a sound phenomenon . '' 
UNKNOWN bank ltd. is one japanese bank that decided not to participate in the first ual proposal . 
a UNKNOWN bank spokesman denied that the finance ministry played any part in the bank 's decision . 
`` we made our own decision , '' he said . 
still , mr. utsumi may have a hard time convincing market analysts who have UNKNOWN or UNKNOWN believed that the ministry played a role in UNKNOWN recent moves by japanese banks . 
all week there has been much speculation in financial UNKNOWN in tokyo and abroad about the ministry 's real position . 
bank analysts say ministry officials have been growing increasingly concerned during the past few months about japanese banks getting in over their heads . 
`` the { ministry } thinks the banks do n't know what they are doing , that they have very little idea how to cope with risk , '' said one foreign bank analyst who asked not to be identified . 
`` the { ministry } wants to see the japanese banks pull in their UNKNOWN '' on leveraged buy-outs , he added . 
although some of the japanese banks involved in the first proposed bid for ual UNKNOWN out because they found the terms UNKNOWN , observers here say they have a hard time UNKNOWN that commercial considerations were the only reason . 
japanese banks are under `` political pressure '' as well , the analyst said .

clearly , some financial authorities are concerned about the japanese banks role in leveraged buy-outs . 
at a news conference this week , bank of japan gov. UNKNOWN UNKNOWN cautioned banks to take a `` prudent '' stance regarding highly leveraged deals .

opec 's ability to produce more petroleum than it can sell is beginning to cast a shadow over world oil markets . 
output from the organization of petroleum exporting countries is already at a high for the year and most member nations are running flat out . 
but industry and opec officials agree that a handful of members still have enough unused capacity to UNKNOWN the market and cause an UNKNOWN collapse a few months from now if opec does n't soon adopt a new quota system to UNKNOWN its chronic UNKNOWN . 
as a result , the effort by some oil ministers to get opec to approve a new permanent UNKNOWN agreement next month is taking on increasing urgency . 
the organization is scheduled to meet in UNKNOWN beginning nov. 99 . 
so far this year , rising demand for opec oil and production restraint by some members have kept prices firm despite UNKNOWN cheating by others . 
but that could change if demand for opec 's oil UNKNOWN seasonally early next year as some think may happen . 
opec is currently producing more than 99 million barrels a day , sharply above its nominal , UNKNOWN fourth-quarter ceiling of 99.9 million , according to opec and industry officials at an oil conference here sponsored by the oil daily and the international UNKNOWN UNKNOWN . 
at that rate , a majority of opec 's 99 members have reached their output limits , they said . 
but it is estimated that at least three million barrels a day -- and possibly as much as seven million barrels a day -- of UNKNOWN capacity still exists within opec . 
most is concentrated in five UNKNOWN gulf countries , including his own , UNKNOWN UNKNOWN , UNKNOWN 's oil minister , told the conference friday . 
he puts opec 's current capacity at 99 million to 99 million barrels a day . 
that 's higher than some other estimates . 
UNKNOWN UNKNOWN UNKNOWN , kuwait 's oil minister , recently estimated opec capacity at 99 million barrels a day . 
either way , the UNKNOWN is big enough to keep UNKNOWN balanced oil markets on edge . 
even modest amounts of additional output by those with the huge extra capacity and reserves , such as saudi arabia and UNKNOWN , could upset the market . 
the UNKNOWN oil minister and saudi oil minister UNKNOWN UNKNOWN insisted in their comments to the conference that their countries would act UNKNOWN to maintain a stable market . 
however , in interviews later , both ministers stressed that they expect future opec quotas to be based mainly on the production capacity and reserves of each member . 
under that approach , countries with the most unused oil capacity would get bigger shares of any future increases in opec 's production ceiling than they would under the current system . 
`` if you are already producing at 99 % or 999 % of your capacity , what 's the good to be told you can produce at 999 % of capacity ? '' asked mr. UNKNOWN . 
at an UNKNOWN geneva meeting late last month , opec 's oil ministers UNKNOWN approved another increase of one million barrels a day in their production ceiling . 
they UNKNOWN it out using the existing formula , however , which meant that even those countries that could n't produce more received higher official UNKNOWN . 
the main effect of the ceiling boost was to `` UNKNOWN '' some of the UNKNOWN already coming from the quota UNKNOWN . 
still , there was a UNKNOWN at geneva . 
previously , no opec member had been willing to accept a reduction in its percentage share of the group 's total output target , or ceiling . 
but the concept of disproportionate quotas for those with unused capacity , advanced there in an iranian proposal , was generally endorsed by the ministers . 
in the end politics got in the way . 
UNKNOWN accepted iran 's proposal only so long as it was promised production UNKNOWN with kuwait . 
and the united arab UNKNOWN , a chronic quota UNKNOWN , refused to give any guarantee it would change its ways . 
but the oil ministers continue to study the plan , and it will probably be the basis for discussion at next month 's meeting . 
it 's understood several UNKNOWN already have been worked into the plan . 
the ceiling would be lifted to 99.9 million barrels to provide kuwait and the united arab UNKNOWN much higher official quotas while reducing percentage shares of some others . 
UNKNOWN 's previous conditions are no longer considered a problem , although the united arab UNKNOWN is still an issue .

insisting on a 99.9 % share of any ceiling , saudi officials have long pressed for the pro UNKNOWN distribution of increases to all members . 
in geneva , however , they supported iran 's proposal because it would have left the saudi percentage of the opec total intact , and increased actual saudi volume to nearly 9.9 million barrels daily from five million . 
some of the proposed modifications since , however , call on saudi arabia to `` give back '' to the UNKNOWN pool a UNKNOWN 99,999 barrels . 
though tiny , that 's a reduction in its share .

a successful UNKNOWN mall in a UNKNOWN area UNKNOWN the more typical inner-city pattern , in which commercial areas are taken over by UNKNOWN youth , gangs , and the criminal element , with an erosion of the customer base , development capital , and UNKNOWN . 
major regional and national chain stores are replaced by UNKNOWN operations offering UNKNOWN merchandise at higher prices . 
along with the exodus of shopping opportunities is an exodus of the jobs that the major chains used to provide to community residents . 
thus there is even more to the vermont-slauson center than a good place to shop . 
this UNKNOWN commercial zone becomes , for the residents , a secure UNKNOWN in a UNKNOWN urban UNKNOWN , evidence that community UNKNOWN is not UNKNOWN and that the gangs are not UNKNOWN . 
the center improves the community image to outsiders as well , and may help to arrest , or even reverse , the exodus of capital and investment . 
an additional benefit is the creation of jobs . 
this starts in the construction phase through the use of minority contractors and local workers . 
it continues through the life of the center ; the vermont-slauson center has created 999 permanent private-sector jobs at a one-time cost in public funds of only $ 9,999 per job . 
as many of these jobs are filled by local residents , who move from the welfare UNKNOWN to the tax UNKNOWN , the $ UNKNOWN public investment should repay itself in a few years . 
and that is before consideration of increased state and local revenues from taxes and fees on sales , real estate , licenses and the like . 
profits are also UNKNOWN back into the community ; the non-profit vermont-slauson economic development corp. receives 99 % of the profits from the vermont-slauson center and uses the money to provide moderate and low-cost housing in the community -- now running into the hundreds of units -- as well as commercial and industrial development projects . 
bradford UNKNOWN , director of the mayor 's city economic development office , says : `` there is no question that vermont-slauson had a UNKNOWN effect on the surrounding neighborhood . 
what had been a deteriorated area with nothing but UNKNOWN shops and shoe shops is now UNKNOWN a major upgrading in the housing and commercial stock , thanks to a UNKNOWN UNKNOWN source of UNKNOWN capital that vermont-slauson yields . '' 
another benefit is that substantial UNKNOWN of the UNKNOWN in these centers are minority businessmen and women .

so what 's the catch ? 
primarily that putting one of these inner-city deals together takes time , UNKNOWN , UNKNOWN of vision and negotiating skills that not all developers UNKNOWN . 
security costs are also quite high . 
one of these centers can involve years of negotiating with numerous public agencies , local political leaders , and citizen groups , and with prospective tenants and sources of financing . 
suburban deals are not without their delays and UNKNOWN -- inner-city deals just have more of them . 
security at a typical UNKNOWN inner-city center is impressive , but UNKNOWN . 
the entire site is UNKNOWN by a UNKNOWN UNKNOWN iron UNKNOWN with a small number of UNKNOWN gates .

these security costs are kept UNKNOWN because the centers ' site acquisition , construction , and financing costs were reduced by such programs as urban development action grants , economic development administration grants , community development block grants , tax-free industrial development bonds , enterprise zone tax write-offs , city infrastructure grants , and tax UNKNOWN financing . 
many of these programs no longer exist , or have been severely cut back . 
however , since these centers appear to pay for themselves , there is nothing to prevent state and local governments from UNKNOWN legislation with similar provisions . 
many states already have enterprise zones and legislation that combines tax incentives , loans , and grants to encourage investment in depressed areas with requirements for the hiring of the UNKNOWN and minorities . 
these programs could be expanded to focus on funds for project planning , UNKNOWN sources of funds , and for acquiring a site and preparing it . 
UNKNOWN crime and the fear of it in inner-city commercial areas should give enterprise zones more success than most have enjoyed to date .

new approaches to mall design and operation make it possible to UNKNOWN these markets . 
if the risks and rewards are reasonable , developers will respond . 
government officials who wonder how important it is for them to encourage development in high-risk areas should visit vermont-slauson and grand boulevard plaza and decide for themselves . 
the answer will be obvious .

the UNKNOWN supermarket went out of business last may . 
the reason was not high interest rates or labor costs . 
nor was there a shortage of customers in the area , the residential UNKNOWN section of northern manhattan .

for providing what his customers described as very personal and helpful service . 
for creating a focus for neighborhood life . 
israel ortiz is only one of the thousands of entrepreneurs and their employees who will be injured or killed by crime this year . 
the u.s. bureau of justice statistics reports that almost 9 % of all UNKNOWN workers suffer injuries from crime each year , almost twice the national average and about four times the rate for teachers , truck drivers , medical workers and UNKNOWN salespeople . 
only a few other UNKNOWN have higher reported rates of criminal injury , such as police , UNKNOWN and taxi drivers . 
yet these figures show only the most visible part of the problem . 
recent data from new york city provide more of the picture . 
while by no means the highest crime community in the country , new york is a prime example of a city where crime UNKNOWN small-business development . 
a survey of small businesses there was conducted this spring by UNKNOWN , a policy research organization . 
it gave 9,999 businesses a UNKNOWN and UNKNOWN 999 responses . 
the survey found that over a three-year period 99 % of the firms said employees or owners had been UNKNOWN on their way to or from work or while on the job . 
UNKNOWN percent reported their customers being UNKNOWN . 
crime was the reason that 99 % reported difficulty recruiting personnel and that 99 % said they were considering moving . 
more than one-third of the responding businesses said they suffer from drug dealing and UNKNOWN near their premises . 
in brooklyn and the bronx , one out of four commercial firms is UNKNOWN each year . 
industrial neighborhoods fare even worse , with UNKNOWN rates twice the UNKNOWN average . 
crime is clearly more UNKNOWN to UNKNOWN UNKNOWN than to big businesses . 
two decades ago , the small business administration reported yale UNKNOWN albert UNKNOWN 's landmark study of crime against 9,999 small businesses drawn from national irs records . 
he found that monetary crime losses , as a proportion of gross receipts , were 99 times higher for small businesses than for large ones . 
the new york study 's companies averaged 99 employees ; their annual crime losses averaged about $ 99,999 , with an additional $ 9,999 annual cost in security -- enough money to hire at least one more worker . 
the costs of crime may also be enough to UNKNOWN a struggling business . 
whatever the monetary crime losses , they may not be nearly as important to entrepreneurs as the risk of personal injury . 
after repeated UNKNOWN UNKNOWN , some entrepreneurs may give up a business out of fear for their lives . 
one washington couple recently sold their liquor store after 99 years in business that included four UNKNOWN deaths and 99 UNKNOWN or UNKNOWN on the premises . 
these findings UNKNOWN the UNKNOWN cycle that national institute of justice director james k. stewart calls `` crime causing poverty . '' 
UNKNOWN neighborhoods offer relatively few employment opportunities , contributing to the poverty of local residents . 
small neighborhood businesses could provide more jobs , if crime were not so UNKNOWN to creating and maintaining those businesses . 
this may help explain why small businesses create 99 % of all jobs nationally , but only 99 % of jobs in a UNKNOWN city like new york . 
bigger business can often better afford to UNKNOWN the cost of crime . 
the new york study found that the cost of security measures in firms with fewer than five employees was almost $ 9,999 per worker , compared with one-third that amount for firms with more than 99 employees . 
the shift of retailing to large shopping centers has created even greater economies of scale for providing UNKNOWN business UNKNOWN . 
private security guards and UNKNOWN police can UNKNOWN the law of UNKNOWN to regulate access to these UNKNOWN places . 
since 9999 , in fact , revenues of the 99 largest guard companies , primarily serving such big businesses , have increased by almost 99 % . 
few small neighborhood businesses , however , can afford such protection , even in UNKNOWN with other local merchants .

this creates several problems . 
one is that there are not enough police to UNKNOWN small businesses . 
the number one proposal for reducing crime in the new york survey was to put more police on foot or UNKNOWN UNKNOWN , suggested by more than two-thirds of the respondents . 
only 99 % supported private security patrols funded by the merchants themselves . 
a second problem is the persistent frustration of false UNKNOWN , which can make urban police less than UNKNOWN about responding to calls from small businesses . 
only half the new york small businesses surveyed , for their part , are satisfied with the police response they receive . 
some cities , including new york , have UNKNOWN with special tax districts for commercial areas that provide additional patrols funded by local businesses . 
but this raises added cost barriers to urban UNKNOWN .

for cities losing business to suburban shopping centers , it may be a UNKNOWN business investment to help keep those jobs and sales taxes within city limits . 
increased UNKNOWN of business zones makes sense because urban crime is heavily concentrated in such `` hot spots '' of UNKNOWN UNKNOWN .

diversification pays .

but several other types of funds UNKNOWN investors from the worst of the market 's slide .

UNKNOWN funds , for instance , which invest in companies that mine and process the precious metal , posted an average decline of 9.99 % . 
flexible portfolio funds , which UNKNOWN investments among stocks , bonds and money-market instruments and other investments , declined at about half the rate of stock funds -- an average drop of 9.99 % , according to lipper . 
global allocation funds take the UNKNOWN concept one step further by investing at least 99 % of their portfolios outside the u.s. . 
this gives them the added benefits of international diversification -- including a foreign-exchange boost during periods , like the past week , when the dollar declines against other major currencies . 
with all that going for them , global flexible portfolio funds declined only 9.99 % in the week through last thursday . 
but while the UNKNOWN of diversification UNKNOWN through when times are tough , there 's also a price to pay : a diversified portfolio always UNKNOWN an UNKNOWN portfolio during those times when the investment in the UNKNOWN portfolio is truly hot . 
and friday the 99th UNKNOWN , stocks have been this year 's hot investment . 
thus , even including the latest week , the average general stock fund has soared more than 99 % so far this year , the lipper analytical figures show . 
by comparison , global asset allocation funds have turned in an average total return of about 99 % , while domestic flexible portfolios are up about 99 % . 
fixed-income funds have returned 9.9 % , while gold funds , which tend to be volatile , have risen just 9.99 % , on average . 
`` that 's the problem with trying to hedge too much , '' said mr. UNKNOWN . 
`` you do n't make any real money . ''

bullish bond market sentiment is on the rise again . 
as the government UNKNOWN to release the next batch of economic reports , the consensus among economists and money managers is that the news will be negative . 
and that , they say , will be good for bonds . 
`` recent data have indicated somewhat weaker economic activity , '' said UNKNOWN platt , director of economic research at donaldson , lufkin & jenrette securities . 
mr. platt is advising clients that `` the near-term direction of bond prices is likely to remain upward . '' 
analysts insist that even without help from a shaky stock market , which provided a temporary boost for bonds during the oct. 99 stock market plunge , bond prices will start to climb on the prospects that the federal reserve will allow interest rates to move lower in the coming weeks . 
that would be UNKNOWN to fixed-income investors , many of whom were badly burned in the third quarter by incorrectly assuming that the fed would ease . 
investors rushed to buy bonds during the summer as prices soared on speculation that interest rates would continue to fall . 
but when it became clear that rates had UNKNOWN and that the fed 's UNKNOWN policy was on hold , bond yields jumped and prices tumbled . 
long-term bonds have performed UNKNOWN this year . 
for example , a group of long-term treasury bonds tracked by merrill lynch & co. produced a total return of 9 % in the first quarter , 99.99 % in the second quarter and UNKNOWN % in the third quarter . 
total return is price changes plus interest income . 
now some investment analysts insist that the economic climate has turned cold and UNKNOWN , and they are urging clients to buy bonds before the rally begins . 
among other things , economists note that consumer spending is slowing , corporate profit margins are being squeezed , business confidence is slipping and construction and manufacturing industries are depressed . 
at the same time , last week 's consumer price index showed that inflation is UNKNOWN . 
add it all up and it means `` that the fed has a little UNKNOWN to ease its credit policy stance without the risk of UNKNOWN inflation , '' said norman robertson , chief economist at mellon bank corp. , pittsburgh . 
`` i think we will see a federal funds rate of close to 9 9\/9 % in the next two weeks and 9 % by year end . '' 
the federal funds rate , which banks charge each other on overnight loans , is considered an early signal of changes in the fed 's credit policy . 
economists generally agree that the rate was lowered by the fed from around 9 % , where it had been since july , to about 9 9\/9 % in early october on the heels of a weak employment report . 
although the rate briefly drifted even lower following the stock market sell-off that occurred oct. 99 , it ended friday at about 9 99\/99 % . 
james UNKNOWN , chief fixed-income strategist at merrill lynch , is UNKNOWN UNKNOWN securities , which he says should benefit more quickly than UNKNOWN bonds as interest rates fall . 
`` given our forecast for lower rates , purchases made now should prove quite rewarding before year end , '' he said . 
mr. UNKNOWN also likes long-term , investment-grade corporate bonds and long-term treasurys . 
he says these bonds should appreciate in value as some investors , reacting to the recent turmoil in the stock and high-yield junk bond markets , seek safer securities . 
`` if the { tennessee valley authority } sale is any guide , there appears to be good demand for UNKNOWN , long-term paper from both domestic and overseas accounts , '' he said .

a majority of japanese banks are said to be wary of making new loans to mexico under the brady plan because they 're uncertain the mexican economy will remain stable . 
instead , many small and medium-sized banks , and some larger ones , are likely to take one of the other two options open to them under the plan , japanese banking officials said . 
the plan , proposed by u.s. secretary of state nicholas brady , calls for banks either to make new loans or to reduce the principle on existing loans or to cut the interest rate on those existing loans . 
the officials said that most japanese banks prefer the losses they 'd suffer in either of the latter options to the risk of new lending . 
but an official at a long-term credit bank explained that since some larger banks have already taken loss provisions for loans to other third world nations , further write-offs could be viewed as UNKNOWN . 
`` they ca n't take the hit '' to their earnings , he said . 
as a result , the official said , they may be forced into a UNKNOWN situation in which they make risky loans that they could have to write off later .

growth is good . 
at least , that 's a theme emerging among many money managers who are anxious both to preserve the UNKNOWN stock-market gains they have already achieved this year and to catch the next wave of UNKNOWN UNKNOWN . 
they are starting to buy growth stocks . 
remember them ? 
the upper UNKNOWN of this group were shares of the `` UNKNOWN 99 '' companies whose profits of the 9999s and early 9999s grew steadily , if not UNKNOWN , through thick and thin . 
that sort of UNKNOWN performance sounds made to order for a time when corporate profits overall have been weakening from the brisk increases of recent years . 
the current flood of third-quarter reports are producing many more negative surprises than positive ones . 
those are unwelcome trends in a year that the dow jones industrial average has risen 99 % so far , even with the 999.99-point plunge on oct. 99 ; broader market measures are in the same neighborhood . 
the question for investors is , how to protect these returns and yet reach a little for additional gains . 
that 's the path of UNKNOWN leading to growth stocks . 
`` i think it is a good theme for what looks to be an uncertain market , '' says steven einhorn , partner at goldman sachs . 
growth stocks may be as big as philip morris or medium-sized such as circuit city stores , but their common UNKNOWN is a history of increasing profits on the order of at least 99 % to 99 % a year , money managers say . 
`` the period when growth stocks should be performing well is when their earnings are growing at a superior rate to the general level of corporate profits , '' says stephen boesel , president of t. rowe price 's growth and income fund . 
growth stocks also are attractive in periods of market volatility , which many investors and analysts expect in the weeks ahead as everybody tries to UNKNOWN where the economy is heading . 
this kind of UNKNOWN uncertainty UNKNOWN john UNKNOWN , senior economist for american express bank , of the 9999-99 period , when the industrial average rolled through huge ranges and investors UNKNOWN to the shares of companies with proven earnings records , which became known as the `` UNKNOWN 99 . friday 's market activity

the collapse of a $ 9.99 billion buy-out of united airlines parent ual corp. has handed wall street 's takeover stock speculators their worst loss ever on a single deal . 
their $ 999 UNKNOWN in estimated paper losses easily tops the $ 999 million in paper losses the takeover traders , known as arbitragers , suffered in 9999 when gulf oil co. dropped a $ 9.9 billion offer for cities service co . 
in the six trading days since the ual labor-management buy-out group failed to get bank financing , UNKNOWN friday with the withdrawal of its partner british airways plc , ual stock has plummeted by 99 % to 999 9\/9 from 999 9\/9 . 
the UNKNOWN may UNKNOWN some of their paper losses if the ual deal gets UNKNOWN up again , as they did in 9999 when occidental petroleum co. UNKNOWN them with a $ 9 billion takeover of cities service . 
in the meantime , the question faced by investors is : what is ual stock worth ? 
the short answer , on a fundamental basis , is that airline analysts say the stock is worth somewhere between $ 999 and $ 999 a share . 
that 's based on a multiple of anywhere between 9.9 to 99 times ual earnings , which are estimated to come in somewhere around $ 99 a share this year . 
airline stocks typically sell at a discount of about one-third to the stock market 's UNKNOWN ratio -- which is currently about 99 times earnings . 
that 's because airline earnings , like those of auto makers , have been subject to the cyclical UNKNOWN of the economy . 
that analysis matches up with stock traders ' reports that , despite the huge drop in the stock , ual has n't returned to the level at which it could attract buying by institutions solely on the basis of earnings . 
so anyone buying the stock now is betting on some special transaction such as a recapitalization or takeover , and must do so using some UNKNOWN about the likelihood of such an event . 
one analyst , who asked not to be identified , said he believes that the ual pilots and management can put together a bid `` in the $ 999 area , '' but that it could take three to four months to close . 
at that level , and given the uncertainty , he believes ual stock should trade closer to 
other observers note that ual 's board , having accepted a bid of $ 999 a share , might hold out for a new bid much closer to the original level -- even if it means that the management goes back to running the company for a while and UNKNOWN things return to normal . 
by that logic , the closing of a deal could be much further away than three to four months , even though the eventual price might be higher . 
investment bankers following ual agree that the strongest UNKNOWN for an eventual deal is that the pilots have been attempting a buy-out for more than two years , and are n't likely to stop , having come so close to success . 
the pilots have a strong financing UNKNOWN in their UNKNOWN to cut their annual compensation by $ 999 million , and to UNKNOWN $ 999 million from their retirement funds . 
on friday , they also persuaded the ual flight attendants to join them . 
however , investment bankers say that banks are n't likely to lend the almost $ 9 billion that would be necessary for a takeover even at a lower price without someone putting up a hefty UNKNOWN of cash -- probably even greater than the 99 % in cash put up by investors in the leveraged takeover of northwest airlines parent nwa corp. in july . 
banks want to see someone putting up real cash at risk , that is , subordinate to the bank debt in any deal . 
that way , they figure , someone else has an even stronger UNKNOWN to make sure the deal is going to work , because they would be losing their money before the banks lost theirs . 
banks also want to be able to call someone on the telephone to fix a problem with a deal that goes bad -- UNKNOWN someone other than a union leader . 
that leaves the pilots still in need of cash totaling around $ 9 billion -- far more than either they or the flight attendants can lay their hands on from retirement funds alone . 
one obstacle to the pilots ' finding such a huge amount of cash is their insistence on majority ownership . 
investors such as marvin davis of los angeles who have sought airline ownership this year have insisted they , not the pilots , must have control . 
one way out of that dilemma could be a partial recapitalization in which the pilots would wind up sharing the value of their concessions with public shareholders . 
the pilots could borrow against the value of their concessions , using the proceeds to buy back stock from the public and give themselves the majority control they have been seeking . 
but it is n't clear that banks would lend sufficient money to deliver a big enough price to shareholders . 
the lack of any new cash probably would still leave the banks UNKNOWN . 
in advising the ual board on the various bids for the airline , starting with one for $ 999 a share from mr. davis , the investment bank of first boston came up with a wide range of potential values for the company , depending on UNKNOWN methods and assumptions . 
using the the nwa takeover as a benchmark , first boston on sept. 99 estimated that ual was worth $ 999 to $ 999 a share based on ual 's results for the 99 months ending last june 99 , but only $ 999 to $ 999 based on a management estimate of results for 9999 . 
first boston 's estimates had been higher before management supplied a 9999 projection . 
using estimates of the company 's future earnings under a variety of UNKNOWN , first boston estimated ual 's value at $ 999 to $ 999 a share if its future labor costs conform to wall street projections ; $ 999 to $ 999 if the company reaches a settlement with pilots similar to one at nwa ; $ 99 to $ 999 under an adverse labor settlement , and $ 999 to $ 999 under a pilot contract imposed by the company following a strike . 
and using liquidation value assuming the sale of all ual assets , first boston estimated the airline is worth $ 999 to $ 999 a share . 
unfortunately , all those estimates came before airline industry fundamentals deteriorated during the past month . 
american airlines parent amr and usair group , both subject to takeover efforts themselves , have each warned of declining results . 
some analysts do n't expect a quick revival of any takeover by the pilots . 
the deal has , as one takeover expert puts it , `` so many moving parts . 
i do n't see anybody who 's sophisticated getting his name associated with this mess until the moving parts stop moving . '' 
in addition to the need for another cash equity investor , the other moving parts include : the pilots themselves , who can UNKNOWN rival deals by threatening to strike ; the machinists union , the pilots ' longtime rivals who helped UNKNOWN the pilots ' deal ; and regulators in washington , whose opposition to foreign airline investment helped throw the deal into doubt . 
in the meantime , the UNKNOWN are UNKNOWN . 
wall street traders and analysts estimate that takeover stock traders own ual stock and options equal to as many as 9.9 million shares , or about 99 % of the total outstanding . 
frank UNKNOWN , an analyst with phoenix capital corp. in new york , estimates that the UNKNOWN paid an average of about $ 999 a share for their ual positions . 
that would indicate that the UNKNOWN have paper losses on ual alone UNKNOWN $ 999 million .

he is currently UNKNOWN what it 's like to have the UNKNOWN , `` under investigation for scientific fraud , '' also attached to his name . 
the nobel committee made the first addition ; john dingell 's congressional committee created the second . 
both of dr. baltimore 's public faces have been on view the past few weeks while he was under consideration to succeed UNKNOWN UNKNOWN as head of the prestigious rockefeller research institution . 
it came to light that a substantial number of rockefeller 's faculty were upset over or even opposed to dr. baltimore 's impending appointment . 
they were UNKNOWN at what they regarded as dr. baltimore 's UNKNOWN attitude toward the dingell committee , which held hearings on a dispute over the UNKNOWN UNKNOWN of a researcher who had UNKNOWN a scientific paper with dr. baltimore . 
readers of these columns ( `` the science police , '' may 99 ) will recall that dr. baltimore was merely the most well-known part of the dingell committee 's larger investigation , which touched UNKNOWN , UNKNOWN , UNKNOWN , the national institutes of health and elsewhere . 
rep. dingell even managed to UNKNOWN the services of the secret service in his investigation of the baltimore paper . 
UNKNOWN as mr. dingell has a special interest in nih and the institutions that receive its funding , the rockefeller scientists were no doubt UNKNOWN by dr. baltimore 's UNKNOWN public opinion of this congressional UNKNOWN , whose behavior reminded dr. baltimore of the UNKNOWN era . 
this well may be the first time that the venerable rockefeller university has UNKNOWN up publicly against the UNKNOWN now common in american science .

scientists are UNKNOWN who still think that the UNKNOWN movement in this country is n't their concern or that a david baltimore could have somehow UNKNOWN a john dingell . 
( mr. dingell , by the way , has UNKNOWN another nih investigation of the baltimore paper , adding to several previous investigations . 
something other than what most scientists would recognize as the truth is being sought here . ) 
fortunately , there are signs that increasing numbers of scientists understand the necessity of speaking out . 
david UNKNOWN , a nobel UNKNOWN at harvard , has taken the lead in UNKNOWN research with animals , as has dr. michael UNKNOWN . 
nasa defended itself UNKNOWN and successfully against a UNKNOWN suit to block the galileo launch . 
scientists need to understand that while they tend to believe their work is UNKNOWN about establishing new knowledge or doing good , today it is also about power . 
in a UNKNOWN world , scientists may earn wide UNKNOWN and even UNKNOWN for their work , but they also attract the attention of people who wish to gain control over the content , funding and goals of that work . 
when a david baltimore -- or the next target -- decides it is better to stand up to these forces , his fellow scientists would do well to recognize what is UNKNOWN at stake , and offer their public support .

freight rates , declining for most of the decade because of competition spurred by deregulation , are UNKNOWN out , turning upward and threatening to fuel inflation . 
trucking , shipping and air-freight companies have announced rate increases , scheduled for this fall or early next year , reflecting higher costs and UNKNOWN demand for freight transport . 
major shippers say they expect freight rates to rise at least as fast as inflation and maybe faster in the next few years . 
that 's a big change from recent years when freight UNKNOWN was a bright spot for u.s. productivity , helping to UNKNOWN inflation and make u.s. industry more competitive abroad . 
`` demand has caught up with the supply of certain types of freight transportation , and rates are starting to move up '' at a rate `` close to or slightly more than the inflation rate , '' said UNKNOWN UNKNOWN , director of UNKNOWN at du pont co . 
shippers surveyed recently by ohio state university said they expect their UNKNOWN , storage and distribution costs to rise about 9 % this year . 
only 99 % of the 999 shippers UNKNOWN expected their UNKNOWN costs to decrease , compared with 99 % who had looked to freight transport to reduce costs in past years . 
`` this is the first year since transportation deregulation in 9999 that we have had such a dramatic and UNKNOWN UNKNOWN in perceived transportation rates , '' said bernard UNKNOWN , a transportation UNKNOWN professor at ohio state in columbus . 
the deregulation of UNKNOWN and trucking companies that began in 9999 enabled shippers to bargain for transportation . 
carriers could use their equipment more UNKNOWN , leading to UNKNOWN they were eager to fill . 
shippers cut about $ 99 billion from their annual , UNKNOWN truck and rail costs , to about $ 999 billion , or about 9.9 % of gross national product , down from 9 % of gnp in 9999 . 
but with much of the UNKNOWN squeezed out of the UNKNOWN system , rising costs are likely to be reflected directly in higher freight rates . 
`` shippers are saying ` the party 's over , ' '' said mr. UNKNOWN . 
`` shippers wo n't be able to look for UNKNOWN savings as they have for the last eight or nine years . 
transport rates wo n't be an opportunity for offsetting cost increases in other segments of the economy . '' 
robert UNKNOWN , a consultant at arthur d. little inc. , cambridge , mass. , said `` we 've gotten all the benefits of deregulation in UNKNOWN reductions . 
now we are starting to see real UNKNOWN increases as carriers replace equipment , pay higher fuel costs and pay more for labor . 
you 'll see carriers try to UNKNOWN some of the price cutting that occurred previously . '' 
not everyone believes that the good times are over for shippers . 
`` there 's still a lot of pressure on rates in both rail and truck , '' said gerard UNKNOWN , UNKNOWN in transportation at massachusetts institute of technology . 
UNKNOWN companies , which carry the freight of several shippers in each truck UNKNOWN , discounted away a 9.9 % rate increase implemented last april . 
the carriers were competing fiercely for market share . 
UNKNOWN increases are likely to be UNKNOWN by weakening UNKNOWN levels and UNKNOWN competition for freight from trucks . 
an official at consolidated UNKNOWN inc. , a menlo park , calif. , UNKNOWN carrier , said rate discounting in that industry has begun to `` stabilize . '' 
consolidated UNKNOWN plans to raise its rates 9.9 % late this year or early next year , and at least two competitors have announced similar increases . 
UNKNOWN are `` trying to send signals that they need to stop the UNKNOWN , forget about market share and go for higher rates , '' said michael lloyd , an analyst at salomon UNKNOWN . 
and `` shippers are getting the feeling that they have played one UNKNOWN off against another as much as they can , '' he said . 
air-freight carriers raised their rates for u.s. products going across the pacific to asia by about 99 % earlier this month . 
and japan air lines said it plans to boost its rates a further 99 % over the next two years . 
such rate increases `` will increase the total cost of u.s. products and slow down the rate of increase of u.s. exports , '' said richard UNKNOWN , a senior vice president of UNKNOWN air & sea service u.s.a. inc. , the u.s. UNKNOWN subsidiary of nippon UNKNOWN UNKNOWN of japan . 
ship companies carrying bulk commodities , such as oil , grain , coal and iron UNKNOWN , have been able to increase their rates in the last couple of years . 
some bulk shipping rates have increased `` 9 % to 9 % in the past few months , '' said salomon 's mr. lloyd . 
and ship lines carrying containers are also trying to raise their rates .

bob stone UNKNOWN over a letter from his manager putting him on UNKNOWN for UNKNOWN . 
mr. stone thought the discipline was unfair ; he believed that his manager wanted to get rid of him for personal reasons . 
unable to persuade the manager to change his decision , he went to a `` company court '' for a hearing . 
at the scheduled time , mr. stone entered a conference room in a building near where he worked . 
after the three members of the court introduced themselves , the chairman of the panel said : `` go ahead and tell us what happened . 
we may ask questions as you go along , or we may wait until the end . '' 
no lawyers or tape recorders were present . 
the only extra people were a couple of personnel specialists , one of whom knew mr. stone 's case UNKNOWN and would help fill in any facts needed to give the court the full picture . 
over a cup of coffee , mr. stone told his story . 
he talked about 99 minutes . 
when he was through , the court members asked many questions , then the chairman said they would like to hear his manager 's side and talk to witnesses . 
the chairman promised mr. stone a decision within two weeks . 
bob stone is a UNKNOWN name , but the incident described is real . 
it happened at northrop corp. in los angeles . 
the court is called the management appeals committee , or just `` mac , '' and it is likely to hear a couple of dozen cases a year . 
alter some details of this example and it could be taking place today at federal express in UNKNOWN , the defense and UNKNOWN systems divisions of honeywell in minneapolis , a general electric plant in columbia , md. , or a number of other companies . 
these firms are UNKNOWN in a significant new trend in the corporate world : the rise of what i call corporate due process . 
although corporate due process is UNKNOWN today in few companies -- perhaps 99 to 99 -- it is one of the UNKNOWN developing trends in industry . 
in the coming decade a majority of UNKNOWN companies are likely to adopt it . 
corporate due process appeals to management for a variety of reasons . 
it reduces lawsuits from disgruntled employees and UNKNOWN , with all that means for reduced legal costs and better public relations . 
it helps to keep out unions . 
it increases employee commitment to the company , with all that means for efficiency and quality control . 
what must your management team do to establish corporate due process ? 
here are four key steps : 
9 . make sure you have a strong personnel department . 
it must be able to handle most of the complaints that can not be solved in the UNKNOWN by managers and their UNKNOWN , else the company court or UNKNOWN will be UNKNOWN with cases . 
at polaroid , the personnel policy planning committee may hear only about 99 cases a year ; the rest of the many hundreds of complaints are resolved at earlier stages . 
at UNKNOWN , the system board of adjustment UNKNOWN 99 to 99 cases a year , only a fraction of the complaints brought to personnel specialists . 
at citicorp , the problem review board may hear only 99 or so cases because of personnel 's UNKNOWN in UNKNOWN . 
in a typical year , up to 99 % of the work force goes to personnel specialists with complaints of unfair treatment . 
in a large company that means many hundreds of complaints for personnel to handle . 
9 . formally or UNKNOWN , train all your managers and supervisors in the company 's due-process approach . 
see that they know company personnel policy UNKNOWN and UNKNOWN , for it is the `` law '' governing company courts and UNKNOWN . 
UNKNOWN them in handling complaints so that they can resolve problems immediately . 
in case managers and personnel specialists are unsuccessful and UNKNOWN take their complaints to a company court or UNKNOWN , teach managers to accept UNKNOWN as a fact of business life , for in a good due-process system they are UNKNOWN to happen . 
in the 99 companies i studied , reversal rates range on the average from 99 % to 99 % . 
9 . decide whether you want a panel system or a single UNKNOWN . 
a panel system like that in the bob stone example UNKNOWN such advantages as high credibility and , for the UNKNOWN , mutual support . 
an UNKNOWN system -- that is , an UNKNOWN who acts first as a UNKNOWN and then switches hats and UNKNOWN the facts -- has such advantages as speed , flexibility and maximum privacy . 
international business machines and bank of america are among the companies using the UNKNOWN approach . 
9 . make your due-process system visible . 
it wo n't do any good for anybody unless employees know about it . 
most UNKNOWN UNKNOWN to go all out in advertising their due-process systems for fear of encouraging UNKNOWN and chronic UNKNOWN to file complaints . 
on the other hand , they make sure at a minimum that their systems are described in their employee UNKNOWN and talked up by personnel specialists . 
UNKNOWN UNKNOWN goes further and sometimes features its UNKNOWN procedure in UNKNOWN tv programs . 
naturally , one of the best ways to guarantee UNKNOWN for your due-process system is for top management to support it . 
at ibm , the company 's open door system is sometimes the subject of UNKNOWN from the chief executive . 
federal express goes further in this respect than any company i know of with both frederick smith and james UNKNOWN , chief executive and chief operating officer , respectively , sitting in on the appeals board almost every tuesday to decide cases . 
mr. UNKNOWN is a consultant based in UNKNOWN , mass. , and author of `` justice on the job : UNKNOWN UNKNOWN in the UNKNOWN workplace '' ( harvard business school press , 9999 ) .

the u.s. is required to notify foreign UNKNOWN if it knows of coup plans likely to UNKNOWN their lives , government officials said . 
the notification policy was part of a set of guidelines on handling coups UNKNOWN in a secret 9999 exchange of letters between the reagan administration and the senate intelligence committee . 
the existence of the guidelines has become known since president bush disclosed them privately to seven republican senators at a white house meeting last monday . 
officials familiar with the meeting said mr. bush cited the policy as an example of the sort of congressional requirements the administration contends contribute to the failure of such covert actions as this month 's UNKNOWN effort to oust panamanian dictator manuel noriega . 
according to the officials , mr. bush even read to the senators UNKNOWN from a highly classified letter from the committee to the white house discussing the guidelines . 
they said the president conceded the notification requirement did n't affect his decision to lend only minor support to this month 's panama coup effort . 
no notification was ever considered , officials said , apparently because the u.s. did n't think the coup UNKNOWN intended to kill mr. noriega , but merely sought to UNKNOWN him . 
what 's more , both administration and congressional officials hint that the notification requirement is likely to be dropped from the guidelines on coup attempts that are being UNKNOWN by the panel and the white house . 
the UNKNOWN was launched at a meeting between mr. bush and intelligence committee leaders oct. 99 , a few days before the meeting at which the president complained about the rules . 
however , the disclosure of the guidelines , first reported last night by nbc news , is already being interpreted on capitol hill as an unfair effort to pressure congress . 
it has reopened the bitter UNKNOWN between the white house and congress over who is responsible for the failure to oust mr. noriega and , more broadly , for difficulties in carrying out covert activities abroad . 
a statement issued by the office of the committee chairman , sen. david boren ( d. , UNKNOWN ) , charged that the disclosure is part of a continuing effort to shift the criticism for the failure of the recent coup attempt in panama . 
the statement added , `` someone has UNKNOWN chosen to UNKNOWN UNKNOWN UNKNOWN of highly classified UNKNOWN between the two branches of government . 
not only does this come close to a violation of law , it UNKNOWN the trust we have all worked to develop . '' 
sen. boren said , `` it 's time to stop UNKNOWN and work together to develop a clear and appropriate policy to help the country in the future . 
i 've invited the president to send his suggestions to the committee . '' 
republican sen. william cohen of maine , the panel 's vice chairman , said of the disclosure that `` a text UNKNOWN out of context is a UNKNOWN , and it is unfair for those in the white house who are UNKNOWN to present the evidence in a selective fashion . '' 
sen. boren said the committee could n't defend itself by making the documents public because that would violate UNKNOWN rules . 
but the chairman and other committee members stressed that the notification guideline was n't imposed on the white house by a UNKNOWN congress . 
instead , both congressional and administration officials agreed , it grew out of talks about UNKNOWN in panama that were initiated by the administration in july 9999 and stretched into last october . 
the guideline was n't a law , but a joint interpretation of how the u.s. might operate during foreign coups in light of the longstanding presidential order banning a u.s. role in assassinations . 
in fact , yesterday the administration and congress were still UNKNOWN on what had been agreed to . 
one administration official said notification was required even if the u.s. `` gets wind '' of somebody else 's coup plans that seem likely to UNKNOWN a dictator 's life . 
but a congressional source close to the panel said the rule only covered coup plans directly involving the u.s. . 
although the notification guideline was n't carried out in this month 's coup attempt , some administration officials argue that it may have led to UNKNOWN and uncertainty on the part of u.s. intelligence and military UNKNOWN in panama . 
one senior administration official called the guideline `` UNKNOWN '' and said it could make u.s. UNKNOWN reluctant to even listen to coup plans for fear they may get into legal trouble . 
the issue came to a head last year , officials UNKNOWN , partly because the reagan administration had sought unsuccessfully to win committee approval of funding for new panama coup efforts . 
in addition , both administration and congressional officials said the need for guidelines on coups and assassinations was partly spurred by a white house desire to avoid nasty overseas surprises during the election campaign . 
though the assassination ban is a white house order that congress never voted on , the intelligence committees can exercise influence over its interpretation . 
last week , central intelligence agency director william webster publicly called on congress to provide new UNKNOWN of the assassination order that would permit the u.s. more freedom to act in coups . 
the administration has reacted to criticism that it UNKNOWN the latest coup attempt by seeking to blame congress for restrictions the white house said have hampered its freedom of action . 
however , last week mr. webster 's two top cia UNKNOWN said congressional curbs had n't hampered the spy agency 's role in the coup attempt in panama . 
nevertheless , the administration 's criticisms appeared to have made some UNKNOWN with UNKNOWN boren and cohen after their oct. 99 meeting with the president . 
the three men agreed to UNKNOWN the guidelines , without changing the basic assassination ban , to clear up any UNKNOWN that may have hampered u.s. UNKNOWN of coups against UNKNOWN leaders . 
the new argument over the notification guideline , however , could sour any atmosphere of cooperation that existed .

( during its centennial year , the wall street journal will report events of the past century that stand as milestones of american business history . ) 
mutual funds arrived in the u.s. during the UNKNOWN UNKNOWN ( they had been in britain for a century ) , but they did n't boom until the money market fund was created in the 9999s . 
by 9999 , there were more than 999 such funds . 
besides creating a vehicle for investors , money market funds also helped UNKNOWN banking regulations . 
the idea was to let small investors , the UNKNOWN of the fund business , deal in the money market 's high short-term interest rates . 
this had been the exclusive province of those rich enough to use UNKNOWN sums to get income that was figured beyond the third or fourth UNKNOWN place . 
the UNKNOWN price of $ 9 a share came about by accident . 
an early fund had filed a registration with the securities and exchange commission that included a fixed $ 9 price . 
it arrived just as the regulator handling such operations was retiring . 
his successor approved the $ 9 price in the process of clearing the UNKNOWN papers on his desk . 
when dreyfus started the first UNKNOWN retail fund in february 9999 , it was priced at $ 99 a share ( and reached $ 9 billion in assets in one year . ) 
dreyfus moved to the $ 9 price after the sec set standards -- an average 999-day maturity of high-grade paper -- that are still the rule . 
keeping the listed price at a dollar is primarily a UNKNOWN . 
actually , the funds do UNKNOWN , but beyond the third UNKNOWN place . 
UNKNOWN keeps them at $ 9 . 
eventually , the money funds ' success forced UNKNOWN of curbs on bank interest rates to allow banks to offer competing yields . 
the new instrument also introduced many to the industry -- 99 % of fund owners ( there are more than 99 million accounts ) started with a money fund . 
today more than 999 money market funds have total assets exceeding $ 999 billion . 
( the UNKNOWN tax-exempt funds add $ 99 billion . ) 
dreyfus alone has seen its money market funds grow from $ 9 billion in 9999 to closes to $ 99 billion today .

the economy , he noted , moves the market , not vice UNKNOWN .

october is a critical month for the privatization program . 
manila is offering several major assets for the first time and is trying to conclude sales already arranged .

the privatization program is designed to rid the government of hundreds of assets and to raise UNKNOWN needed funds .

the UNKNOWN appears to be that the more valuable the asset , the harder the privatization process . 
`` you just do n't see a whole lot happening , '' says an international economist . 
to be sure , the program has n't completely stalled . 
the asset privatization trust , the agency UNKNOWN responsible for selling UNKNOWN properties , has recorded sales of more than $ 999 million since it began UNKNOWN in december 9999 . 
but its success has been largely in the sale of small , nonperforming companies , which are valued for their assets . 
dealing with the sales this month could be particularly challenging because almost every problem that has UNKNOWN the program in the past is UNKNOWN up again .

october 's troubles began when the trust failed to sell a state-owned commercial bank , associated bank , for the minimum price of 999 million UNKNOWN ( $ 99 million ) . 
at the end of the month , the agency again will offer the bank . 
but instead of a minimum price , only a target price will be established . 
bankers say , however , that the government may have difficulty selling the institution even without a floor price . 
the bank has a negative net worth , they say . 
in addition , special bidding rules give the bank 's former owner , UNKNOWN UNKNOWN , the right to match the highest bid . 
mr. UNKNOWN lost control to the government in 9999 when a government bank made emergency loans to the UNKNOWN institution . 
in 9999 , the loans were converted into equity , giving manila 99 % of the bank , but with the understanding that mr. UNKNOWN had repurchase rights . 
his ability to match any bid has scared off many potential buyers .

( about 9.9 % of picop is publicly traded and other shareholders own the rest of the equity . ) 
potential buyers , mostly foreign companies , are reluctant to take a UNKNOWN stake in a company that , by the government 's own UNKNOWN , needs some $ 999 million in new capital for rehabilitation .
