in august , soon after wang laboratories inc. reported a staggering $ 999.9 million loss and replaced its president , two boston sales representatives sent customers a letter saying : `` we fully expect that you will soon be reading stories in the press reporting the ` amazing comeback at wang . ' '' 
how soon wang will stage a comeback , or if it will at all , are still matters of debate . 
but wang salespeople are trying to cope with the biggest challenge any marketer can face : selling the products of a company that is on the ropes . 
`` if your prospect is feeling risk the whole time and you 're not feeling as if you 're backed up by a stable company , you 've lost it before you 've begun , '' says mary ann UNKNOWN , a UNKNOWN , mass. , sales UNKNOWN and consultant who works with high technology companies . 
it can happen in any industry . 
consider the difficulties faced by UNKNOWN salespeople when the car was tainted by false charges of sudden acceleration , or exxon dealers ' problems in the wake of the UNKNOWN oil spill . 
like thousands of salespeople before them , wang 's are finding ways to combat the bad news .

wang got into financial trouble because of UNKNOWN overhead and UNKNOWN optimistic sales forecasts . 
its UNKNOWN UNKNOWN and word processors have lost ground to cheaper personal computers . 
last year it funded its high employment by heavy borrowing , and it suffered huge losses when sales turned down instead of rising . 
after the company reported red ink for the fiscal third quarter , wang 's marketing department provided the sales force answers to questions such as `` how could you not have known you were going to lose $ 99 million ? '' and `` is wang still a viable company ? ''

we tell them all the major companies are having financial difficulties . ''

from 9999 to 9999 , 9.9 billion kent cigarettes with the filters were sold , the company said .

yields on money-market mutual funds continued to slide , amid signs that portfolio managers expect further declines in interest rates . 
the average seven-day compound yield of the 999 taxable funds tracked by UNKNOWN 's money fund report eased a fraction of a percentage point to 9.99 % from 9.99 % for the week ended tuesday . 
compound yields assume UNKNOWN of dividends and that the current yield continues for a year . 
average maturity of the funds ' investments UNKNOWN by a day to 99 days , the UNKNOWN since early august , according to donoghue 's . 
longer maturities are thought to indicate declining interest rates because they permit portfolio managers to retain relatively higher rates for a longer period . 
UNKNOWN maturities are considered a sign of rising rates because portfolio managers can capture higher rates sooner . 
the average maturity for funds open only to institutions , considered by some to be a stronger indicator because those managers watch the market closely , reached a high point for the year -- 99 days . 
nevertheless , said UNKNOWN UNKNOWN UNKNOWN , editor of money fund report , yields `` may UNKNOWN up again before they UNKNOWN down '' because of recent rises in short-term interest rates .

despite recent declines in yields , investors continue to UNKNOWN cash into money funds . 
assets of the 999 taxable funds grew by $ 9.9 billion during the latest week , to $ 999.9 billion . 
typically , UNKNOWN yields beat comparable short-term investments because portfolio managers can vary maturities and go after the highest rates . 
the top money funds are currently yielding well over 9 % .

mrs. hills said many of the 99 countries that she placed under varying degrees of scrutiny have made `` genuine progress '' on this UNKNOWN issue .

the new , seven-year funds -- one offering a fixed-rate return and the other with a UNKNOWN return linked to the london interbank offered rate -- offer two key advantages to japanese investors . 
first , they are designed to eliminate the risk of UNKNOWN -- mortgage-backed securities can be retired early if interest rates decline , and such UNKNOWN forces investors to UNKNOWN their money at lower rates . 
second , they channel monthly mortgage payments into semiannual payments , reducing the administrative burden on investors .

such devices have boosted japanese investment in mortgage-backed securities to more than 9 % of the $ 999 billion in such instruments outstanding , and their purchases are growing at a rapid rate .

pick a country , any country . 
it 's the latest investment UNKNOWN sweeping wall street : a rash of new closed-end country funds , those publicly traded portfolios that invest in stocks of a single foreign country . 
no fewer than 99 country funds have been launched or registered with regulators this year , triple the level of all of 9999 , according to charles e. simon & co. , a UNKNOWN research firm . 
the turf recently has ranged from UNKNOWN to UNKNOWN to portugal . 
next week , the philippine fund 's launch will be capped by a visit by philippine president UNKNOWN UNKNOWN -- the first time a head of state has kicked off an issue at the big board here . 
the next province ? 
`` anything 's possible -- how about the new UNKNOWN fund ? '' UNKNOWN george foot , a managing partner at UNKNOWN management associates of UNKNOWN , mass . 
the recent explosion of country funds UNKNOWN the `` closed-end fund UNKNOWN '' of the 9999s , mr. foot says , when narrowly focused funds grew wildly popular . 
they fell into UNKNOWN after the 9999 crash . 
unlike traditional UNKNOWN mutual funds , most of these UNKNOWN portfolios are the `` closed-end '' type , issuing a fixed number of shares that trade publicly . 
the surge brings to nearly 99 the number of country funds that are or soon will be listed in new york or london . 
these funds now account for several billions of dollars in assets . 
`` people are looking to stake their claims '' now before the number of available nations runs out , says michael porter , an analyst at smith barney , harris upham & co. , new york . 
behind all the UNKNOWN is some UNKNOWN competition . 
as individual investors have turned away from the stock market over the years , securities firms have scrambled to find new products that brokers find easy to sell . 
and the firms are stretching their UNKNOWN far and wide to do it . 
financial planners often urge investors to diversify and to hold a UNKNOWN of international securities . 
and many emerging markets have UNKNOWN more mature markets , such as the u.s. and japan . 
country funds offer an easy way to get a taste of foreign stocks without the hard research of seeking out individual companies . 
but it does n't take much to get burned . 
political and currency gyrations can UNKNOWN the funds . 
another concern : the funds ' share prices tend to swing more than the broader market . 
when the stock market dropped nearly 9 % oct. 99 , for instance , the mexico fund plunged about 99 % and the spain fund fell 99 % . 
and most country funds were UNKNOWN more than most stocks after the 9999 crash . 
what 's so wild about the funds ' frenzy right now is that many are trading at historically fat premiums to the value of their underlying portfolios . 
after trading at an average discount of more than 99 % in late 9999 and part of last year , country funds currently trade at an average premium of 9 % . 
the reason : share prices of many of these funds this year have climbed much more sharply than the foreign stocks they hold . 
it 's probably worth paying a premium for funds that invest in markets that are partially closed to foreign investors , such as south korea , some specialists say . 
but some european funds recently have UNKNOWN ; spain fund has surged to a startling 999 % premium . 
it has been targeted by japanese investors as a good long-term play tied to 9999 's european economic integration . 
and several new funds that are n't even fully invested yet have jumped to trade at big premiums . 
`` i 'm very UNKNOWN to see these rich UNKNOWN , '' says smith barney 's mr. porter . 
the newly UNKNOWN premiums reflect the increasingly global marketing of some country funds , mr. porter suggests . 
unlike many u.s. investors , those in asia or europe seeking UNKNOWN exposure may be less UNKNOWN to paying higher prices for country funds . 
`` there may be an international UNKNOWN cast on the funds listed here , '' mr. porter says . 
nonetheless , plenty of u.s. analysts and money managers are UNKNOWN at the UNKNOWN trading levels of some country funds . 
they argue that u.s. investors often can buy american depositary receipts on the big stocks in many funds ; these so-called UNKNOWN represent shares of foreign companies traded in the u.s. . 
that way investors can essentially buy the funds without paying the premium . 
for people who insist on jumping in now to buy the funds , UNKNOWN 's mr. foot says : `` the only advice i have for these folks is that those who come to the party late had better be ready to leave quickly .

any reading below 99 % suggests the manufacturing sector is generally declining .

`` i draw a UNKNOWN . ''

yet many economists are n't predicting that the economy is about to slip into recession .

inventories are closely watched for such UNKNOWN , for instance . 
economists say a buildup in inventories can UNKNOWN UNKNOWN in production that can lead to a recession . 
but yesterday 's factory orders report had good news on that front : it said factory inventories fell 9.9 % in september , the first decline since february 9999 . 
`` this UNKNOWN to the ` soft landing ' scenario , '' said UNKNOWN platt , an economist at donaldson , lufkin & jenrette securities corp . 
`` i do n't see any signs that inventories are excessive . '' 
a soft landing is an economic slowdown that UNKNOWN inflation without leading to a recession .

only 99 % of the purchasing managers reported better export orders in october , down from 99 % in september . 
and 9 % said export orders were down last month , compared with 9 % the month before .

interviews with analysts and business people in the u.s. suggest that japanese capital may produce the economic cooperation that southeast asian politicians have pursued in fits and starts for decades . 
but japan 's power in the region also is UNKNOWN fears of domination and UNKNOWN fresh policy questions . 
the flow of japanese funds has set in motion `` a process UNKNOWN these economies will be UNKNOWN together by the great japanese investment machine , '' says robert UNKNOWN , vice chairman of goldman sachs international corp . 
in the past five years , japanese companies have tripled their commitments in asia to $ 9.99 billion . 
in thailand , for example , the government 's board of investment approved $ 999.9 million of japanese investment in 9999 , 99 times the u.s. investment figure for the year . 
japan 's commitment in southeast asia also includes steep increases in foreign assistance and trade . 
asia 's other UNKNOWN countries are following japan 's lead and pumping capital into the region . 
in taiwan and south korea , rising wages are forcing manufacturers to seek other overseas sites for UNKNOWN production . 
these nations , known as asia 's `` little UNKNOWN , '' also are contributing to southeast asia 's integration , but their influence will remain subordinate to japan 's . 
for UNKNOWN countries such as thailand and malaysia , the investment will provide needed jobs and spur growth . 
but asian nations ' harsh memories of their military domination by japan in the early part of this century make them fearful of falling under japanese economic UNKNOWN now . 
because of budget UNKNOWN in washington , the u.s. UNKNOWN japan to share economic burdens in the region . 
but it UNKNOWN yielding political ground . 
in the coming decade , analysts say , UNKNOWN relations will be tested as tokyo comes to terms with its new status as the region 's economic UNKNOWN . 
japan 's UNKNOWN investment in southeast asia is part of its economic evolution . 
in the past decade , japanese manufacturers concentrated on domestic production for export . 
in the 9999s , spurred by rising labor costs and the strong yen , these companies will increasingly turn themselves into UNKNOWN with plants around the world . 
to capture the investment , southeast asian nations will move to accommodate japanese business . 
these nations ' internal decisions `` will be made in a way not to UNKNOWN their largest aid UNKNOWN , largest private investor and largest lender , '' says richard UNKNOWN , director of the international business and research program at the university of southern california 's graduate school of business . 
japanese money will help turn southeast asia into a more UNKNOWN economic region . 
but , analysts say , asian cooperation is n't likely to parallel the european common market approach . 
rather , japanese investment will spur integration of certain sectors , says kent UNKNOWN , a specialist in east asian economies at the UNKNOWN UNKNOWN school for public and UNKNOWN affairs at princeton university . 
in electronics , for example , a japanese company might make television picture UNKNOWN in japan , UNKNOWN the sets in malaysia and export them to UNKNOWN . 
`` the effect will be to pull asia together not as a common market but as an integrated production zone , '' says goldman sachs 's mr. UNKNOWN . 
countries in the region also are beginning to consider a UNKNOWN for closer economic and political ties . 
the economic and foreign ministers of 99 asian and pacific nations will meet in australia next week to discuss global trade issues as well as regional matters such as transportation and telecommunications . 
participants will include the u.s. , australia , canada , japan , south korea and new zealand as well as the six members of the association of southeast asian nations -- thailand , malaysia , singapore , UNKNOWN , the philippines and UNKNOWN .

the baker proposal UNKNOWN washington 's intention to continue playing a leading political role in the region .

`` the u.s. , with its regional friends , must play a crucial role in designing its architecture . '' 
but maintaining u.s. influence will be difficult in the face of japanese UNKNOWN in the region . 
japan not only UNKNOWN the u.s. in investment flows but also UNKNOWN it in trade with most southeast asian countries ( although the u.s. remains the leading trade partner for all of asia ) .

the internal revenue service has threatened criminal sanctions against lawyers who fail to report detailed information about clients who pay them more than $ 99,999 in cash . 
the warnings , issued to at least 999 criminal defense attorneys in several major cities in the last week , have led to an UNKNOWN by members of the organized bar , who claim the information is protected by UNKNOWN privilege . 
the irs warnings stem from a 9999 law that requires anyone who receives more than $ 99,999 in cash from a client or customer in one or more related transactions `` in the course of trade or business '' to report the payment on a document known as form 9999 . 
the form asks for such details as the client 's name , social security number , UNKNOWN number and details about the services provided for the payment . 
failure to complete the form had been UNKNOWN as a UNKNOWN until last november , when congress determined that the crime was a felony UNKNOWN by up to 99 years in prison . 
attorneys have argued since 9999 , when the law took effect , that they can not provide information about clients who do n't wish their UNKNOWN to be known . 
many attorneys have returned incomplete forms to the irs in recent years , citing UNKNOWN privilege . 
until last week , the irs rarely acted on the incomplete forms . 
`` this form forces a lawyer to become , in effect , a witness against his client , '' said neal r. UNKNOWN , president of the national association of criminal defense lawyers . 
`` the irs is asking lawyers to UNKNOWN a criminal problem to the government , '' added mr. UNKNOWN , a miami lawyer who has heard from dozens of attorneys who received letters in recent days and has himself received the UNKNOWN irs forms sent by UNKNOWN mail . 
mr. UNKNOWN said that clients who pay cash may include alleged drug dealers who do n't have domestic bank accounts . 
these individuals may not necessarily be under investigation when they hire lawyers . 
mr. UNKNOWN said there also may be other circumstances under which individuals would n't want the government to know they had retained criminal defense lawyers . 
filling out detailed forms about these individuals would tip the irs off and spark action against the clients , he said . 
the defense lawyers ' group formed a task force this week , UNKNOWN by new york attorney gerald UNKNOWN , to deal with the matter . 
the american bar association 's house of UNKNOWN passed a resolution in 9999 UNKNOWN the irs reporting requirement . 
michael ross , a new york lawyer who heads the UNKNOWN 's grand jury committee , said that lawyers are UNKNOWN by the UNKNOWN 's code of ethics from UNKNOWN information about a client except where a court orders it or to prevent the client from UNKNOWN a criminal act that could result in death . 
mr. ross said he met with officials of the irs and the justice department , which would bring any enforcement actions against taxpayers , to discuss the issue last may . 
at that meeting , he said , the justice department assured him that enforcement procedures would n't be threatened against attorneys without further review and advance notice . 
mr. ross said irs officials opposed the justice department 's moderate stance on the matter .

the transportation department , responding to pressure from safety advocates , took further steps to impose on light trucks and vans the safety requirements used for automobiles . 
the department proposed requiring stronger UNKNOWN for light trucks and minivans , beginning with 9999 models . 
it also issued a final rule requiring auto makers to UNKNOWN light trucks and minivans with UNKNOWN belts for UNKNOWN seats beginning in the 9999 model year . 
such belts already are required for the vehicles ' front seats . 
`` today 's action , '' transportation secretary samuel skinner said , `` represents another UNKNOWN in the ongoing program to promote vehicle UNKNOWN safety in light trucks and minivans through its extension of passenger car standards . '' 
in september , the department had said it will require trucks and minivans to be equipped with the same UNKNOWN UNKNOWN that have long been required on passenger cars . 
the big three auto makers said the rule changes were n't surprising because bush administration officials have long said they planned to impose car safety standards on light trucks and vans . 
safety advocates , including some members of congress , have been urging the department for years to extend UNKNOWN requirements to light trucks and vans , which now account for almost one-third of all vehicle sales in the u.s. . 
they say that many vehicles UNKNOWN as commercial light trucks actually carry more people than cargo and therefore should have the same safety features as cars . 
they did n't have much luck during the reagan administration . 
`` but now , there seems to be a fairly UNKNOWN effort to address the problem , '' said chuck UNKNOWN , vice president of communications for the insurance institute for highway safety . 
`` we 're in a very different regulatory environment . '' 
sen. john UNKNOWN ( r. , UNKNOWN . ) praised the department 's actions , noting that UNKNOWN UNKNOWN account for almost half of all UNKNOWN deaths . 
`` we could prevent many of these UNKNOWN with minimum UNKNOWN standards , '' he said . 
sen. UNKNOWN and others also want the department to require additional safety equipment in light trucks and minivans , including air bags or automatic seat belts in front seats and improved UNKNOWN protection . 
the department 's UNKNOWN proposal would apply to vehicles UNKNOWN 99,999 pounds or less . 
the UNKNOWN would be required to withstand a force of 9.9 times the UNKNOWN weight of the vehicle . 
during the test , the roof could n't be depressed more than five inches . 
in detroit , a chrysler corp. official said the company currently has no UNKNOWN UNKNOWN and shoulder belts in its light trucks , but plans to begin UNKNOWN them in by the end of the 9999 model year . 
he said chrysler fully expects to have them installed across its UNKNOWN line by the sept. 9 , 9999 , deadline . 
chrysler said its trucks and vans already meet the UNKNOWN resistance standard for cars .

signs of a slowing economy are increasing pressure on the federal reserve to cut short-term interest rates , but it is n't clear whether the central bank will do so . 
a survey by the fed 's 99 district banks shows economic growth has been sluggish in recent weeks , while upward pressures on prices have UNKNOWN . 
`` the economy is clearly slowing , '' says robert black , president of the richmond federal reserve bank . 
`` if you look at the third quarter as posting roughly 9.9 % growth , i do see some slowing in the fourth quarter , '' agrees kansas city fed president roger UNKNOWN . 
nevertheless , both mr. UNKNOWN and mr. black say the slowdown so far is no cause for concern . 
`` we 're coming closer to UNKNOWN the stated objective of slowing the economy to a point where hopefully some downward trend in prices will occur , '' said mr. UNKNOWN . 
bush administration officials are looking to the fed to bring down rates , and financial markets seem to be expecting easier credit as well . 
`` i think the market had been expecting the fed to ease sooner and a little more than it has to date , '' said robert johnson , vice president of global markets for bankers trust co . 
the fed cut the key federal funds interest rate by about 9.99 percentage point to 9.99 % after the oct. 99 stock market plunge , but has shown no sign of movement since . 
the report from the fed found that manufacturing , in particular , has been weak in recent weeks . 
the philadelphia fed , for instance , reported that manufacturing activity `` continues to decline '' for the fourth month in a row . 
and in the chicago district , the report said , `` a manufacturer of capital goods noted slower orders for some types , including defense equipment , petroleum equipment , food packaging machinery and material handling equipment . '' 
retail sales also were reported slow in most districts , particularly `` for discretionary , UNKNOWN items such as furniture , home appliances and consumer electronics . '' 
and construction also was described as slow in most areas . 
despite the economic slowdown , there are few clear signs that growth is coming to a halt . 
as a result , fed officials may be divided over whether to ease credit . 
several fed governors in washington have been pushing for easier credit ; but many of the regional fed presidents have been UNKNOWN such a move . 
mr. black said he is `` pleased '' with the economy 's recent performance , and does n't see `` a lot of UNKNOWN out there that would tilt us into recession . '' 
`` there is always a chance of recession , '' added mr. UNKNOWN , `` but if you ask me to put a percentage on it , i would think it 's well below a 99 % chance .

criticism in the u.s. over recent japanese acquisitions is UNKNOWN ever larger in the two countries ' relations .

where they disagree is on the subject of u.s. direct investment in japan . 
the u.s. wants the removal of what it UNKNOWN as barriers to investment ; japan denies there are real barriers . 
the UNKNOWN talk UNKNOWN up by recent japanese investments in the u.s. is focusing attention on the differences in investment climate , even though it 's only one of many subjects to be covered in the UNKNOWN talks , known as the structural UNKNOWN initiative .

the japanese UNKNOWN openly about the u.s. public 's UNKNOWN .

while mr. UNKNOWN and japanese officials say the question of investors ' access to the u.s. and japanese markets may get a disproportionate share of the public 's attention , a number of other important economic issues will be on the table at next week 's talks .

while worry grows about big japanese investments in the u.s. , japan 's big trading companies are rapidly increasing their stake in america 's smaller business . 
for japan , the controversial trend improves access to american markets and technology . 
but for small american companies , it also provides a growing source of capital and even marketing help . 
take the deal with candela laser corp. , a UNKNOWN , mass. , manufacturer of high-tech medical devices , which three years ago set its UNKNOWN on japan as an export market . 
partly to help clear the UNKNOWN UNKNOWN facing any overseas company trying to UNKNOWN japan , tiny candela turned to mitsui & co. , one of japan 's largest trading companies , for investment . 
in a joint-venture deal , mitsui UNKNOWN candela through tokyo 's bureaucratic UNKNOWN . 
it eventually secured ministry of health import approval for two candela laser products -- one that breaks up kidney stones and another that UNKNOWN skin UNKNOWN . 
at last count , candela had sold $ 9 million of its medical devices in japan . 
the deal also gave mitsui access to a high-tech medical product . 
`` they view this as a growth area so they went about it with a UNKNOWN approach , '' says richard UNKNOWN , a candela vice president . 
indeed , for many japanese trading companies , the favorite u.s. small business is one whose research and development can be UNKNOWN for future japanese use . 
the japanese companies UNKNOWN many small u.s. companies with promising products or ideas , frequently putting their money behind projects that commercial banks wo n't touch . 
japanese companies have financed small and medium-sized u.s. firms for years , but in recent months , the pace has taken off . 
in the first half of 9999 alone , japanese corporations invested $ 999 million in minority positions in u.s. companies , a 99 % rise from the figure for all of 9999 , reports venture economics inc . 
the needham , mass. , concern tracks investments in new businesses . 
in addition , of course , some of the japanese investments involved outright purchase of small u.s. firms . 
heightened japanese interest in american small business UNKNOWN an acceleration of investments giving japanese companies control of large , highly visible u.s. corporations , such as columbia pictures entertainment inc . 
only this week , it was announced that mitsubishi estate co. had acquired a 99 % stake in rockefeller group , which owns new york 's prestigious rockefeller center . 
while the small deals are far less UNKNOWN , they add to japanese UNKNOWN of the u.s. market . 
as the deals also improve japanese access to american technology and market knowledge , they feed american UNKNOWN in this area , too .

for 99 years , UNKNOWN UNKNOWN went to her neighborhood bank because it was UNKNOWN . 
a UNKNOWN customer that banks UNKNOWN for , she did n't give much thought to the rates she was receiving , nor to the fees she was paying . 
but in august , first atlanta national bank introduced its crown account , a package designed to lure customers such as ms. UNKNOWN . 
among other things , it included checking , safe deposit box and credit card -- all for free -- plus a good deal on installment loans . 
all she had to do was put $ 99,999 in a certificate of deposit , or qualify for a $ 99,999 personal line of credit . 
`` i deserve something for my loyalty , '' she says . 
she took her business to first atlanta . 
so it goes in the competitive world of consumer banking these days . 
for nearly a decade , banks have UNKNOWN for customers primarily with the interest rates they pay on their deposits and charge on their loans . 
the competitive rates were generally offset by hefty fees on various services . 
but many banks are turning away from strict price competition . 
instead , they are trying to build customer loyalty by UNKNOWN their services into packages and targeting them to small segments of the population . 
`` you 're dead in the water if you are n't UNKNOWN the market , '' says anne moore , president of UNKNOWN research corp. , a bank consulting firm in atlanta . 
UNKNOWN corp. of charlotte , n.c. , recently introduced its financial UNKNOWN program aimed at young adults just starting UNKNOWN . 
the program not only offers a UNKNOWN car loan up to $ 99,999 , but throws in a special UNKNOWN statement to help in saving money . 
in september , union UNKNOWN corp. of UNKNOWN , tenn. , launched the edge account , a package designed for the `` UNKNOWN '' crowd with services that include a credit card and line of credit with no annual fees , and a full percentage point off on installment loans . 
the theory : such individuals , many with young children , are in their prime borrowing years -- and , having borrowed from the bank , they may continue to use it for other services in later years . 
for some time , banks have been UNKNOWN packages at the elderly , the UNKNOWN segment with the highest savings . 
those efforts are being stepped up . 
UNKNOWN macdonald , vice president of retail sales at UNKNOWN banks inc. of UNKNOWN , fla. , says the company now targets UNKNOWN within the market by UNKNOWN its popular seniors partners program to various life UNKNOWN . 
`` varying age , geography and UNKNOWN differences create numerous UNKNOWN , '' ms. macdonald says .

`` an active 99-year-old in UNKNOWN UNKNOWN may care more about senior olympic games , while a 99-year-old in panama city may care more about a UNKNOWN on health , '' she says . 
banks have tried packaging before . 
in 9999 , wells fargo & co. of san francisco launched the gold account , which included free checking , a credit card , UNKNOWN box and travelers checks for a $ 9 monthly fee . 
the concept UNKNOWN a slew of UNKNOWN , but the banks stopped promoting the packages . 
one big reason : thin margins . 
many banks , particularly smaller ones , were slow to UNKNOWN and could n't target market UNKNOWN that would have made the programs more profitable . 
as banks ' earnings were squeezed in the mid-9999s , the emphasis switched to finding ways to cut costs . 
but now computers are enabling more banks to UNKNOWN their customers by age , income and geography . 
they are better able to get to those segments in the wake of the deregulation that began in the late 9999s . 
deregulation has effectively removed all restrictions on what banks can pay for deposits , as well as opened up the field for new products such as UNKNOWN cds . 
where a bank once offered a standard UNKNOWN savings account , it began offering money-market accounts , certificates of deposit and UNKNOWN checking , and staggering rates based on the size of deposits . 
the competition has grown more intense as bigger banks such as UNKNOWN corp. of minneapolis and chemical banking corp. of new york extend their UNKNOWN UNKNOWN into small towns across the nation . 
`` today , a banker is UNKNOWN about local , regional and UNKNOWN { banks } , as well as thrifts and credit unions , '' says ms. moore at UNKNOWN research . 
`` so people who were n't even thinking about targeting 99 years ago are scrambling to UNKNOWN their customer base . '' 
the competition has UNKNOWN a much UNKNOWN consumer . 
`` the average household will spread 99 accounts over a dozen financial institutions , '' says michael p. sullivan , who runs his own bank consulting firm in charlotte , n.c . 
`` this much UNKNOWN makes attracting and keeping today 's UNKNOWN customers costly . '' 
packages encourage loyalty by rewarding customers for doing the bulk of their banking in one place . 
for their troubles , the banks get a larger UNKNOWN audience that is less likely to move at the drop of a rate . 
the more accounts customers have , mr. sullivan says , the more likely they are to be attracted to a package -- and to be loyal to the bank that offers it . 
that can pay off down the road as customers , especially the younger ones , change from borrowers to UNKNOWN / investors . 
packaging has some drawbacks . 
the additional technology , personnel training and promotional effort can be expensive .

if the 99-point limit is triggered after 9:99 p.m . chicago time , it would remain in effect until the normal close of trading at 9:99 p.m . 
with the limit in effect , members would be able to execute trades at the limit price or at higher prices , but not below it . 
the exchange said it decided a new circuit breaker was needed following a review of the tumultuous trading in stocks and stock-index futures on friday oct. 99 , when the dow jones industrials plunged 999 points and stock-index futures prices skidded as well .

investors unsettled by the stock market 's gyrations can take some comfort in the predictable UNKNOWN of quarterly dividend checks . 
that has been particularly true this year with many companies raising their payouts more than 99 % . 
but do n't UNKNOWN too easy : those dividend increases may signal trouble ahead for stock prices , some analysts UNKNOWN . 
in the past , they say , the strongest dividend growth has often come at times when the stock-market party was almost over . 
that can be a trap for UNKNOWN investors , says richard UNKNOWN , senior UNKNOWN analyst at merrill lynch & co . 
strong dividend growth , he says , is `` the black widow of UNKNOWN '' -- a reference to the female UNKNOWN that attract UNKNOWN and then kill them after UNKNOWN . 
stephen boesel , president of t. rowe price growth and income fund , explains that companies raise their payouts most UNKNOWN only after the economy and corporate profits have been growing for some time . 
`` UNKNOWN , those strong periods in the economy give way to UNKNOWN UNKNOWN , '' he says . 
`` and UNKNOWN UNKNOWN are n't UNKNOWN to the stock market . '' 
indeed , analysts say that payouts have sometimes risen most sharply when prices were already on their way down from cyclical UNKNOWN . 
in 9999 , for example , dividends on the stocks in standard & poor 's 999-stock index soared 99 % , following much slower growth the year before . 
the s&p index started sliding in price in september 9999 , and fell 99 % in 9999 -- despite a 99 % expansion in dividends that year . 
that pattern has n't always held , but recent strong growth in dividends makes some market UNKNOWN anxious . 
payouts on the s&p 999 stocks rose 99 % in 9999 , according to standard & poor 's corp. , and wall street estimates for 9999 growth are generally between 9 % and 99 % . 
many people believe the growth in dividends will slow next year , although a minority see double-digit gains continuing . 
meanwhile , many market UNKNOWN say recent dividend trends raise another warning flag : while dividends have risen UNKNOWN , their expansion has n't kept pace with even stronger advances in stock prices . 
as a result , the market 's dividend yield -- dividends as a percentage of price -- has slid to a level that is fairly low and UNKNOWN by historical standards . 
put another way , the decline in the yield suggests stocks have gotten pretty rich in price relative to the dividends they pay , some market analysts say . 
they are keeping a close watch on the yield on the s&p 999 . 
the figure is currently about 9.9 % , up from 9.9 % before the recent market slide . 
some analysts say investors should run for the UNKNOWN if a sustained market rebound UNKNOWN the yield below 9 % . 
a drop below that 9 % benchmark `` has always been a strong warning sign that stocks are fully valued , '' says mr. boesel of t. rowe price . 
in fact , `` the market has always UNKNOWN . 
always . 
there 's never been an exception , '' says gerald w. UNKNOWN , a chicago investment adviser and money manager , based on a review of six decades of stock-market data . 
the last time the s&p 999 yield dropped below 9 % was in the summer of 9999 . 
stockholders who took the hint and sold shares escaped the october debacle . 
there have been only seven other times -- in 9999 , 9999 , 9999 , 9999 , 9999 , 9999 and 9999 -- when the yield on the s&p 999 dropped below 9 % for at least two consecutive months , mr. UNKNOWN found . 
and in each case , he says , a sharp drop in stock prices began within a year . 
still , some market analysts say the current 9.9 % reading is n't as troublesome as it might have been in years past . 
`` it 's not a very UNKNOWN indicator currently because corporations are not UNKNOWN in a traditional manner , '' says james h. UNKNOWN , head of stock investments for cigna corp. , the UNKNOWN insurer . 
in particular , mr. UNKNOWN says , businesses are paying out a smaller percentage of their profits and cash flow in the form of dividends than they have historically . 
so , while stock prices may look fairly high relative to dividends , they are not excessive relative to the underlying corporate strength . 
rather than increasing dividends , some companies have used cash to buy back some of their shares , notes steven g. einhorn , co-chairman of the investment policy committee at goldman , sachs & co . 
he factors that into the market yield to get an adjusted yield of about 9.9 % . 
that is just a UNKNOWN below the average of the past 99 years or so , he says . 
what will happen to dividend growth next year ? 
common wisdom suggests a UNKNOWN rate of growth , reflecting a weakening in the economy and corporate profits . 
painewebber inc. , for instance , is forecasting growth in s&p 999 dividends of just under 9 % in 9999 , down from an estimated 99 % this year . 
in other years in which there have been moderate economic UNKNOWN -- the environment the firm expects in 9999 -- the change in dividends ranged from a gain of 9 % to a decline of 9 % , according to painewebber analyst thomas UNKNOWN . 
the minority argument , meanwhile , is that businesses have the financial UNKNOWN this time around to UNKNOWN sharply higher dividends even if their earnings weaken . 
dividend growth on the order of 99 % is expected by both mr. UNKNOWN of cigna and mr. einhorn of goldman sachs . 
those dividend UNKNOWN argue that corporations are in the unusual position of having plenty of cash left over after paying dividends and making capital expenditures . 
one indicator investors might want to watch is the monthly UNKNOWN from standard & poor 's of the number of public companies adjusting their dividends . 
a total of 999 companies raised dividends in october , basically unchanged from 999 a year ago , s&p said wednesday . 
that followed four straight months in which the number of increases trailed the year-earlier pace . 
while the s&p UNKNOWN does n't measure the magnitude of dividend changes , a further UNKNOWN in the number of dividend increases could be a UNKNOWN of slower dividend growth next year . 
in any case , opinion is mixed on how much of a boost the overall stock market would get even if dividend growth continues at double-digit levels . 
mr. einhorn of goldman sachs estimates the stock market will deliver a 99 % to 99 % total return from appreciation and dividends over the next 99 months -- vs. a `` cash rate of return '' of perhaps 9 % or 9 % if dividend growth is weak . 
but mr. boesel of t. rowe price , who also expects 99 % growth in dividends next year , does n't think it will help the overall market all that much . 
`` having the dividend increases is a supportive element in the market outlook , but i do n't think it 's a main consideration , '' he says . 
with slower economic growth and flat corporate earnings likely next year , `` i would n't look for the market to have much upside from current levels .

program traders are UNKNOWN of predicting that if they are blocked in the u.s. , they will simply UNKNOWN to foreign stock markets . 
but in london and tokyo , where computer-driven trading now plays a small but growing role , traders say a number of hurdles UNKNOWN . 
government officials , especially in japan , probably would resist any UNKNOWN of program trading by players trying to UNKNOWN off the u.s. UNKNOWN over their activities and UNKNOWN abroad with their business . 
japan is `` very concerned '' about the possible effects of program trading , a senior japanese official said after the oct. 99 stock plunge in new york . 
u.s. stock-index futures are n't even traded in japan now . 
and because of the time difference , the japanese and the u.s. markets ' trading hours do n't UNKNOWN . 
it all adds up to a barrier to UNKNOWN index arbitrage , the most popular form of u.s. program trading that seeks to exploit brief differences between prices of stocks in new york and the price of a futures contract in chicago based on those stocks . 
about 99.9 % of all program trading by new york stock exchange firms in september took place in foreign markets , according to big board data . 
yet it is difficult to imagine japan racing to introduce UNKNOWN stock-index futures . 
japan 's finance ministry already is UNKNOWN institutional investors ' activity to see whether policy changes are needed to cope with the current level of program trading , said UNKNOWN utsumi , vice minister for international finance . 
program trading has taken off in japan since last year 's introduction of UNKNOWN stock-index futures trading on the tokyo and UNKNOWN stock exchanges . 
but regulators are wary . 
they have n't forgotten the leap in share prices last dec. 9 , when the first UNKNOWN of UNKNOWN index arbitrage drove stocks UNKNOWN in the last half-hour of trading , startling regulators who thought they had written enough rules to prevent such a swing . 
japan 's finance ministry had set up UNKNOWN to limit how far futures prices could fall in a single session and to give market operators the authority to suspend trading in futures at any time . 
`` maybe it was n't enough , '' a finance ministry official noted after the dec. 9 surge . 
japan 's regulators have since UNKNOWN controls on UNKNOWN stock purchases . 
tokyo 's leading program traders are the big u.s. securities houses , though the japanese are playing UNKNOWN . 
some u.s. firms , notably salomon inc. and morgan stanley group inc. , have UNKNOWN a hefty chunk of their japanese earnings from index arbitrage , both for customers and for their own accounts . 
( morgan stanley last week joined a growing list of u.s. securities firms that have stopped doing index arbitrage for their own accounts . ) 
both UNKNOWN c. UNKNOWN , who heads salomon in tokyo , and john s. UNKNOWN , who heads morgan stanley there , UNKNOWN a good part of their firms ' success in tokyo to their ability to offer sophisticated , futures-related investment strategies to big institutional clients . 
they do n't have plans to cut back . 
`` it has not been UNKNOWN in the markets here , '' mr. UNKNOWN said . 
`` the real difference seems to be that the cash market here ... is big enough and liquid enough that the futures market is n't having the same impact it does in america . '' 
the british also are UNKNOWN program trades . 
UNKNOWN trading is `` something we want to watch closely , '' an official at london 's stock exchange said . 
`` we do n't think there is cause for concern at the moment . '' 
london serves increasingly as a UNKNOWN for program trading of u.s. stocks . 
market professionals said london has several UNKNOWN . 
first , the trading is done over the counter and is n't reported on either the u.s. or london stock trading UNKNOWN . 
second , it can be used to UNKNOWN positions before u.s. trading begins , but at prices pegged to the previous session 's big board close . 
in addition to the extra privacy of these trades , the transactions can often be less expensive to execute , because the parties do n't have to pay a floor brokerage fee or a specialist 's fee . 
still , `` much less { UNKNOWN activity } is done over here than in the u.s. '' said richard UNKNOWN , chief investment manager at standard life assurance co. , which manages about # 99 billion ( $ 99.99 billion ) in united kingdom institutional funds . 
britain has two main UNKNOWN instruments . 
a financial times-stock exchange 999-share index option contract is traded on the london stock exchange 's traded options market . 
and an ft-se futures contract is traded on the london international financial futures exchange . 
both contracts have gained a following since the 9999 global market crash . 
the average number of ft-se option contracts traded on the london exchange has surged nearly tenfold since the contract 's launch in 9999 . 
this year , the average of daily contracts traded totaled 9,999 , up from 9,999 a year earlier and from 999 in 9999 . 
but a survey early this summer indicated that the volume of UNKNOWN trading was only 99 % of the size of the underlying equity market , exchange officials said . 
this compares with estimates that the u.s. `` UNKNOWN '' market is perhaps four times as large as the underlying domestic market . 
the house voted to boost the federal minimum wage for the first time since early 9999 , casting a solid 999-99 vote for a compromise measure backed by president bush . 
the vote came after a debate UNKNOWN with complaints from both proponents and critics of a substantial increase in the wage floor . 
advocates said the UNKNOWN rise , to $ 9.99 an hour by april 9999 , is too small for the working poor , while opponents argued that the increase will still hurt small business and cost many thousands of jobs . 
but the legislation reflected a compromise agreed to on tuesday by president bush and democratic leaders in congress , after congressional republicans urged the white house to UNKNOWN a bit from its previous resistance to compromise . 
so both sides accepted the compromise , which would lead to the first UNKNOWN of the minimum wage since a four-year law was enacted in 9999 , raising the wage to $ 9.99 an hour from $ 9.99 . 
under the measure passed yesterday , the minimum wage would rise to $ 9.99 next april . 
the senate plans to take up the measure quickly and is expected to pass it . 
`` there are no UNKNOWN about this bill , '' rep. UNKNOWN williams ( d. , UNKNOWN . ) said during house floor debate yesterday . 
but `` because it 's all we 've got , i 'm going to vote for it . '' 
while the minimum wage had traditionally been pegged at half the average u.s. manufacturing wage , the level of $ 9.99 an hour in 9999 will still be less than 99 % of average factory pay , mr. williams said . 
but rep. UNKNOWN UNKNOWN ( r. , n.j . ) instead praised the house 's acceptance of a new youth `` training '' wage , a UNKNOWN that gop UNKNOWN have sought for many years . 
adopting a UNKNOWN policy means `` getting beyond the nickel and UNKNOWN of the minimum wage , '' mrs. UNKNOWN said . 
policy makers regard the youth wage as helping to limit the loss of jobs from an increase in the minimum wage , but they have lately UNKNOWN it as necessary to help UNKNOWN job skills to UNKNOWN into the work force . 
labor unions and democrats long fought the idea , but recently UNKNOWN to it in the face of bush administration insistence . 
the compromise sets the training wage at $ 9.99 an hour next april , and at $ 9.99 an hour , or 99 % of the minimum wage , in april 9999 . 
employers can pay the UNKNOWN for 99 days , without UNKNOWN , to workers with less than six months of job experience , and for another 99 days if the company uses a UNKNOWN training program for the young workers . 
the training wage covers only workers who are 99 to 99 years old . 
the white house previously insisted on an UNKNOWN six-month training wage that could be paid any time a worker of any age took a new job . 
the u.s. chamber of commerce , still opposed to any UNKNOWN increase , said the compromise plan to lift the wage floor 99 % in two stages between april 9999 and april 9999 `` will be impossible for many employers to accommodate and will result in the elimination of jobs for american workers and higher prices for american consumers .
